The moto kangbei driver breaks often, so he spends a lot of money to repair it. Facing this, Rin decides to apply for a loan to buy a new Remoque Kang Bei.

loans.use: to buy a new Remoque Kang Bei.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is 47 years old woman. She lives in Marneuli district with her son, daughter-in-law, infant grandson and father-in-law. Aida is an accountant. She works hard for different shops as an accountant and gets monthly income. Other members of her family are unemployed. As her income is not enough for the family, Aida decided to start her own business for additional income. She decided to start a clothing trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Aida’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $3,000, she will start trading clothing. Aida plans to go to Turkey to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then resell in her region at higher prices. This will increase the income of her family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to begin selling clothing.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 45 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Fely works very hard to provide for them.

Fely runs a a business buying and selling nipa roofing and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy material and equipment for her business.

Fely has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Fely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy material and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
26 years old Regina is a single mother of one child and also supports her family. She has been running a boutique business in Nairobi for 4 years and currently makes a monthly income of KES 3,000. 

This is her first loan term with KADET LTD and she will use the loan to buy more clothes, shoes and bags to sell in her boutique. She will use her anticipated profits to expand her business by purchasing more stock of clothes and shoes. 

Regina's future hopes and dreams are to grow her business, make more income and give her child a good education.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes, shoes and bags for sell.

loans.name: Ndungu

texts.en:
Ndungu is 41 years old and has a knitting and sewing business in Kangundo town. He makes sweaters, table mats and chair cushions. He is married and has two children. He has been in this business for 14 years and it has been profitable. Besides this, he also has a vehicle with which he has a transport business.

This is his first loan term and he plans to use the loan to buy knitting materials for knitting sweaters. These include different varieties of wool and threads. He anticipates making more income from selling sweaters and he will use the generated profits to buy more material.

Ndungu hopes to grow his business, buy another vehicle for transport business and also give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy knitting materials.

loans.name: Gbémihoedé

texts.fr: Gbémihoedé est une femme de 53ans. Elle est mariée à un mécanicien et mère d'un enfant de 32ans. En 2012, elle a démarré le commerce de vente des produits congelés. Elle souhaite acquérir plus de marchandises c'est pour cela, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit. Elle espère ouvrir une boutique et voir sa famille s'épanouir.
texts.en: Gbémihoedé is a 53-year-old woman. She is married to a mechanic and is the mother of a 32 year old child. In 2012, she began her business of selling frozen foods. She hopes to acquire more merchandise for this business, which is why she is requesting her first loan from WAGES. She hopes to be able to open a shop and see her family prosper.

loans.use: to purchase frozen foods

loans.name: Christian Flaubert

texts.fr: flaubert est un jeune entrepreneur de 28 ans qui travail dans la climatisation. il est marié  et père  d'un enfant et ayant à sa charge 3 autres personnes.A cette date, il a 5 ans d’expérience dans son activité et le succès de cette activité est lié à un besoin de la cliente en service de réparation de plus en plus demandé ce qui prouve d'ailleurs la prospérité de son entreprise.Avec le crédit qui lui sera accordé,il va viabiliser le volume de ses activités, améliorer sa condition de vie et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Flaubert is a young entrepreneur of 28 years who works in air conditioning. He is married and the father of one child and has 3 other people in his care. He currently has 5 years of experience in his business and the success of this business is due to an ever increasing demand of customers for air conditioning repair, which has proven to be the success of his business. With this loan, he will increase the volume of his business, improve his living conditions, and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to grow his business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, 29 years of age, is a single mother with two children. She owns a green grocery shop in Nairobi's Kitengela area where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for two and a half years and it has been profitable.

Lilian plans to use this loan amount to buy more vegetables to sell in her business. She will also buy more potatoes, fruits and tomatoes. She hopes to make more income with which to start a cereal shop. 

This is Lilian's first loan term with Kiva's partner Kadet Limited and her future hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land for her family.

loans.use: to stock additional produce to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 48 years old and runs a food stall in one of Nairobi's estates. She sells french fries and it has been profitable for the 5 years that she has been in this business. She is married and has five children. She also supports her parents. Her husband, who is a farmer, also provides income to support the family.

This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan to buy potatoes. This will enable her to have more in stock and thereby meet her customers' demands. She will use the anticipated income to open another business.

Christine's future hopes and dreams are to provide good living standards for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of potatoes to be able to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
This is Lanie. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more pork and chicken for her business. The loan helped not just in her business but also in giving her children an education.  She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. The income generated by her loan assists their household expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan for her to buy more pork and chicken for her business. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lanie dreams that her business will become stable and hopes that her children will have a good life and education. She meets up with her fellowship group members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more pork and chicken to sell at her business.

loans.name: Gañaloma  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Gañaloma está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en el cantón Nabon lugar que tiene un clima frió, cuenta con verdes praderas y hermosos paisajes gracias a su geografía, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno. Su gente guarda celosamente su cultura y tradiciones que aprendieron de sus padres, en su mayoría se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, algunos salen a la ciudad a ejercer varios trabajos, los que les permiten mejorar su situación económica.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Patricia, esta realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Gañaloma, le gusta esta forma de créditos ya que todas tienen una muy buena amistad y en las reuniones pueden conversar de varios temas de su interés.

La Señora. Patricia tiene23 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 6, 5 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la localidad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Patricia pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en su casa al cuidado de sus hijos que aun son pequeños, pero para apoyarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la cría de borregos, cuyes y chanchos, también labora en la agricultura y lo que cosecha lo vende. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de abono, semillas y en alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es tener un negocio propio como una tienda.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Gañaloma credit group consists of 8 members (7 women, 1 man) who live in the canton of Nabon. This is a region that has a cold climate but green meadows and beautiful landscapes due to its geography. Its architecture is a mixture of colonial and modern. The people fiercely guard the culture and traditions that they learned from their parents. The majority work raising livestock and farming. Some go out to the city to perform different jobs, which allows them to improve their economic situation.

Patricia is one of the women of this group. She is obtaining her second loan in the company of her friends and companions in the Gañaloma credit group. She likes this form of loan because they all share a very good friendship and in the meetings they can talk about different subjects that interest them.

Patricia is 23, married and has 3 children who are 6, 5 and 2 years old. Her oldest two children attend a local school. Her husband works in the construction field as a mason. They live in their own house.

Patricia spends the majority of her time at home caring for her children, who are still small. But to support her husband with living costs she raises sheep, guinea pigs and pigs and also works in agriculture, selling what she harvests.

She is planning to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of fertilizer, seed and feed for her animals. Her dream is to have a business of her own, such as a store.

The small photograph is a member who was not able to be present when the group photograph was taken.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and animal feed.

loans.name: Relfa

texts.en:
Relfa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hardware business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 60,000 through NWTF to purchase additional hardware materials to sell in her hardware business.

Relfa has been in this business for eight years. Relfa earns more income from direct selling beauty products.

Relfa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional hardware materials to sell.

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Rith (pictured here) sells mangoes. His wife is now a garment worker.  He buys mangoes under contract from villagers from the blooming season until the harvesting season. He needs to use pesticide to prevent mangoes from being attacked by insects. 
Hence, he decides to apply for a loan to buy pesticide to protect mango from insect bites.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect mango from insect bites.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn dreams to be successful both in business and life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sophin

texts.en:
Sophin (in the photo) is 39 year old, sells drinking water, soft drinks and beer at home. She lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh city and has two children. Both of her children are garment workers. 
Sophin hopes to buy more soft drinks and beer for resale. That’s why she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and beer for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 50 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school.  Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through Kiva's partner NWTF to purchase more nipa roofing to sell.  Nancy has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret runs a mobile money transfer business (M-PESA) in the town of Kangundo, Kenya.  She is 37 years old and married with two children. She sells phone credit cards.  She has been in the business for two years and it has been profitable. In addition, she is also a farmer. 

This being her first loan term with KADET Ltd, Margaret plans to use the loan amount to increase the float money supply for her mobile money transfer business. She will use the generated profits to educate her children and buy more cows.

Margaret's future hopes and dreams are to start a wholesale business, educate her children and also further her studies to a masters level.

loans.use: to support her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Katenga Turibamwe Group

texts.en:
Joy is a member of Katenga Turibamwe group, which is in Katenga sub-county - Mitooma district. She has borrowed two times from UGAFODE Micro-finance and hopes to get another loan of 500,000 (Five hundred thousand shillings) to boost her goats trading business which she has done since 1999.

Joy also sells bananas, which gives her additional income to cater for the needs of her family. She does the business in a rural area in Kakyera1 - Bitooma, and her clients are consumers and fellow traders. 

She has high hopes that her business will expand and she will be able to make more profits. 

Joy describes herself as an honest and trusted business partner but says her business still faces a challenge of inadequate capital, though she hopes that this will be no more if the loan is given and she buys the goats when the prices are still low.

loans.use: to buy goats for breeding and resale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has a bakery in Kitengela town. She is 39 years of age and a single mother of four children. She has been running this business for one year now. 

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd and she will use it to buy another oven. This will enable her to bake more bread, buns and scones to sell and supply to various retailers and hotels in the area. She will use the anticipated profits to pay for her children’s school fees.

Hannah's future hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy an oven for use in her bakery business.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Ii Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento  NUEVA ESPERANZA II  está  compuesto por ocho integrantes, cinco mujeres y tres varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Eliana se dedica  a la fabricación y venta de cotillones y piñatas para todo tipo de acontecimientos ya sea bautizos matrimonios, fiestas de quince años, ella entrega a distintas tiendas, mercados, y también le hacen pedido para el decorado de fiestas,  es una cliente nueva de la institución , con el dinero del crédito comprara  material para la fabricación de piñatas y cotillones y así brindar variedad de cotillones a sus clientes , la Sra. Eliana se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le brinda para crecer en su negocio ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien sigue creciendo en su actividad y de esta manera genera más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
The communal lending group Nueva Esperanza or “New Hope” is comprised of eight members- five women and three men. The president of the communal lending group is Eliana. She makes and sells party favors and piñatas for all kinds of events, whether it be baptisms, marriages, or quinceneras. She sells to different stores and markets, and also takes orders for decorating parties. 

She is a new borrower in the institution. With the money from the loan, she will purchase material to make piñatas and party favors so she can offer a variety of party supplies to her customers. 

Eliana feels grateful for the opportunity to grow in her business that the loan provides her. The last loan went well for her. She wants to continue growing her activity and this way generate more income for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: purchase materials to make pinatas and party favors

loans.name: Medina

texts.ru: Медине 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Медины - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Медина занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Медины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, а также имеет 5,70 ГА земельной доли на которой она ежегодно сажает фасоль и пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Медина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Медина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Medina is 42 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Medina has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Medina works with livestock breeding, after having started 18 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Medina's persistent work, her farm currently has one dairy cow, one bull and also 5.70 hectares of land. On this she plants beans and wheat every year. The monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Medina turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of calves to increase the number of livestock. Medina plans to invest the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and plans to save up money to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Jumabu

texts.ru: Жумабу 65 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Жумабу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жумабу занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жумабу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 4 теленка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумабу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жумабу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Jumabu is 65 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband. Jumabu has secondary education. As a main income for her family, Jumabu works with cattle breeding, after having started 17 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Jumabu's persistent work, her farm currently consists of four dairy cows and four calves. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Jumabu turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of calves to increase the number of cattle. Jumabu plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Айгуль - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айгуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 35,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айгуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Aigul is 50 years old, married, and raising four children with her husband.  She has a secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this business 10 years ago when she bought cattle for 5,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to her hard work, Aigul currently owns four dairy cows, one horse and eight sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 35,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy some cows and therefore increase her cattle headcount.

Aigul plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her herd of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Doña Andrea es originaria del municipio de El Sauce donde ha vivido toda su vida, es madre soltera de seis hijos de los cuales solamente una tiene a su cargo. Desde muy joven inició a laborar como obrera en un centro de enseñanza agropecuaria donde es responsable de cocina, ya que elaboran la comida a todos los estudiantes y profesores de ese centro.
Doña Andrea tiene la edad de 56 años y hay momentos que se siente cansada de ejercer ese trabajo que es muy pesado para su edad.
Debido a esto ha estado un poco mal de salud por lo que se presentó a Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento con fondos de los inversionistas de Kiva para comprar  medicamentos, realización de exámenes, de ultrasonidos, pago de consultas médicas y así mejorar su salud para rendir en su trabajo ya que es por medio del cual lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar.
Pide a estos inversionistas que le apoyen con su solicitud para mejorar su salud donde quedará eternamente agradecida.
texts.en:
Andrea is originally from the town of El Sauce, where she has lived all her life.  She’s a single mother with six children, of whom only one still depends on her.  She started to work in the agricultural teaching center when she was very young, where she is currently in charge of preparing food for the students and teachers.

Andrea is 56 years old and there are times when she gets tired of doing this work because it’s tough for her age.  This has caused her to have some health problems and so she is asking CEPRODEL for a Kiva loan to buy medicine, get an ultrasound exam, and pay doctor bills, so she can improve her health and be able to work, since this is the way she earns her daily bread.

She is asking the lenders to support her request; she will be eternally grateful.

loans.use: to buy medicine and pay doctor bills.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 67 years old, runs a hotel business in Nairobi town. She has been in this business for 12 years. She is a widow and has 10 children. 

This is her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan to buy more chairs for use in her hotel business. This will enable her to serve more customers and also generate more profits which she will use to expand the hotel business.

Grace hopes to open another business in future.

loans.use: To buy chairs for her hotel business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has a sewing and knitting business in Nairobi town. She makes sweaters, school uniforms, tablecloths and dresses as well. She is 31 years old and married with 3 children. She has been in this business for 5 years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya Shillings. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more sewing materials for use in her business. These include threads, wool, needles and sewing material. This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she will use the anticipated income to expand her business.

Joyce hopes to grow her business and become a leading entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials.

loans.name: Mary- Ann

texts.en: Mary- Ann is a 24-year-old student of MU Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental studying BS - Information Technology. Her father is a fisherman and her mother is a fish vendor. Together they do everything to make a living. Mary- Ann joined Gata Daku MPC and she borrowed 13,000 PHP to pay the school tuition fees for her BS - Information Tech 4 first semester. She is hopeful of finding a job after finishing her studies to be able to support the needs of her parents and to have a better future of her own.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for her BS - Information Tech 4 first semester

loans.name: Elvin Javier

texts.es:
El señor Elvin Javier es un comerciante que vive en la Ciudad de Condega a unos 35 km de esteli al norte del Nicaragua, este señor esta felizmente casado, vive en su propia casa de habitacion junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas quienes estudian en primaria.
Este cliente de desempeña como orfebre, tiene en su casa un pequeño negocio de joyeria donde el elabora prendas de oro y plata para todos los usos, asi como la reparacion de las mismas, ademas el tambien posee un sistema de perifoneo donde brinda el servicio de auto parlantes para anunciar cualquier tipo de eventos, su esposa le ayuda a a diario en este negocio de donde suge su principal ingreso familiar para el sustento como para los gastos escolares de sus hijas.
estecliente se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de oro y plata en bruto y despues elaborar prendas a partir de la materia prima dandole un valor agregado y por ende recibir un mejor ingreo, el espera que le sea aprobado el credito para poder realizar las compras de la materia prima y poder ir mejorando cada vez mas su negocio y darle un mejor sistema de vida a asu familia ya que dependen directamente de este negocio.
texts.en:
Elvin Javier is a merchant in the city of Condega, located about 35 km from Esteli, in northern Nicaragua.  This gentleman is happily married and lives in a home of his own with his wife and two daughters who attend elementary school. 

He works as a goldsmith and has a small jewelry business in his home, where he makes gold and silver jewelry for all occasions, and also does repairs.  He also has a mobile sound system that he rents out to advertise various types of events.  His wife helps him daily with this business, from where they obtain their main income to pay expenses such as their daughters’ school expenses.

He is asking for a loan, through CEPRODEL, so he can buy gold and silver bars and then make jewelry, increasing the metals’ value and obtaining a better income.  He hopes to be approved for this loan to buy the material and be able to continue improving his business so he can provide a better life for his family, since they depend directly on this business.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver.

loans.name: Yahaira Dominga

texts.es: La señora Yahaira se dedica a impartir clases como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 7 años, es Casada con 1 hijo al que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo, actualmente está señora esta estudiando  la carrera de psicopedagogía estando en su ultimo año, Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Yahaira  presenta es el pago de trámites de Titulo  de Educación primaria en la UNAN, por lo que se decidió  de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito. Ya que esto le ayudara a darle mejores oportunidades de empleo y mejor desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en: Yahaira works as an elementary school teacher in a small local school and has been doing this for seven years.  She’s married and has a son who she must support.  She is currently in her last year of studying to be a psychologist and she needs to be able to pay tuition to UNAN, so she has approached CEPRODEL to request a loan.  This will help provide her with better employment opportunities and better personal and family development.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three school going children. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma has operated a clothes selling business for the past three years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces major challenges of inflation and seasonality in her business. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 29 years old, married, and has one child. She rents out plastic chairs and tables for events and functions such as weddings. She has been in this business for the past three years and currently makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya Shillings. She also has a cereals shop.

This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan to buy more plastic chairs for hire. This will enable her to have more stock of chairs and thereby meet the demands of her customers. She will also use part of the amount to buy more cereals to sell. She will use the anticipated income to add more plastic chairs, tables, and even tents for hire.

Vivian hopes to grow her business and make more income so that she is able to to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy more plastic chairs for hire.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet runs a hotel business in Nairobi town. She has been in the business for 10 years. Violet is 35 years old and married with two children. Her husband also supports her in providing for the needs of the family.

She plans to use this loan to buy more chairs for her hotel. This will enable her to accommodate more customers and make more profits, which she will use to pay for her children's education.

In the future, Violet hopes to buy her own house and her own piece of land.

loans.use: To buy chairs for her hotel.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a very hardworking woman with two school going children. She lives in her own house that has electricity, but not piped water. 

Mwanakombo operates a cafe business where she makes various food such as beans, rice, tea, and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 37-year-old single mother of 3 children aged 12, 9, and 7 years old, and a tailor in Nairobi town. She has been doing this business for 2 years making a monthly income of 8,500 Kenyan Shillings. 

She will use this loan to buy more textile materials and sewing materials such as threads and buttons for use in her tailoring business. This is her first loan term with KADET LTD and she will use the anticipated profits to pay fees for her children and open another shop. 

Her dreams are to have a successful business and raise a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of textile material.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат живет в районе Б.Гафуров города Худжанд, ей 41 год. Она живет с мужем, ему 43 года и сыном, которому 22 года. Она очень рано вышла замуж и родила сына, когда ей было 19, а мужу 21. Саодат милая и ответственная женщина, всегда умевшая сохранять в доме уют, тепло и удобства для своих мужчин. У Саодата среднее техническое образование и талант в области шитья женских национальных платьев. Она собирается открыть швейных цех и начать собственное дело. Саодат на бессрочный срок уже арендовала помещение на рынке района и закупила необходимые рабочие инструменты. Теперь она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести две швейные машинки, а также столы и стулья. 
Саодат планирует шить в день по три платья, а также предполагает брать заказы на шитьё костюмов и брюк. Ее швейный цех будет работать с восьми утра до шести вечера. Саодат верит, что ее услуга будет всегда потребной и ее швейный цех будет иметь успех, так как помещение расположено в самом рынке, где всегда многолюдно.
texts.en:
Saodat lives in the region of B. Gafurov in the town of Khujand. She is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and her son. Her husband is 43 and her son is 22 years old. She has married early and gave birth to her son. She was only nineteen and her husband was 21. Saodat is a nice and responsible woman who can always keep comfort and warmth in her home for her men. Saodat has a secondary technical education and a talent in the field of sewing of traditional women's dresses. She plans to open a sewing shop and start her own business. Saodat has rented out a space on the region's market and purchased necessary instruments. Right now she is asking for a loan to buy two sewing machines and also tables and chairs.

Saodat plans to sew three dresses a day and also offer to take orders to sew suites and pants. Her sewing shop will be open from 8 am to 6 pm. Saodat belives that her service will be always in demand and her sewing shop will always have success because her shop is located on the market where there are a lot of people.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines as well as tables and chairs to open a sewing shop.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with one child who is still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, Asha wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, and maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married to a teacher. She has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as to save for a rainy day. She is a high school graduate, and currently works as a hairdresser in Domenase (near Cape Coast). With over six years of experience in this trade, Aba sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to purchase cream, shampoo and other hairdressing products to expand her business. Aba wants to make her business self-sustaining as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits back into the enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase cream, shampoo and other hairdressing products

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old and married with five children. She sells charcoal in one of Nairobi's estates, and it has been profitable. She has been able to provide for her family's needs with the income from the business together with the support of her husband, who is a cattle herder.

This being her first loan term with KADET LTD, Janet plans to buy more stock of charcoal to sell. She anticipates making more profit, which she will use to open another business. 

Janet hopes to be successful in her business, to make more income and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily lives in the Kongowea area in Kenya. She is married and a mother of two. Emily has been buying and selling items such as televisions, sofa sets and beds for the last few years and the business is really going well. Emily knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy more retail products for the business. This business is the only income that Emily has and her family depends on it. Emily hopes that the business will grow to serve the entire town and generate income for her and the family. The extra income that Emily will earn will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more retail products.

loans.name: Nthenya

texts.en:
Nthenya is 46 years old and married with two children. She sells vegetables, carrots and peas in Nairobi. She has been in this business for nine years and earns a monthly income of 8,500 KES. She also makes clay pots for cooking, storing water and flower vases.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD, and she will use the loan to buy more vegetables, peas and tomatoes for selling. This will enable her to have enough stock and meet the demands of her customers. She will use her profits to buy a plot of land.

Nthenya hopes to grow her business, earn more profits and open another business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne grew up in the Mukuru Kwa Ruben informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya. She was brought up by a single mother in a family of three children. As the eldest daughter in her family, she had the chance to witness firsthand various outbreaks of sanitation-related diseases. Out of this experience, she developed a passion for hygienic sanitation.

Anne seeks a loan to fund the purchase of two Fresh Life toilets, which will be set up in Mukuru to help ease the sanitation problem in the area. She hopes that this venture will make Mukuru a cleaner environment in which to live. She also anticipates that the business will generate enough cash to enable her to go to college and lead a much more productive life.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Marlon José

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, el Señor Marlon, se dedica arduamente a laborar como personal de Vigilancia en un centro de Salud del municipio, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 6 años.
Es casado, no tiene hijos a su cargo,  Una de las  necesidades que el señor atraviesa es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que esta en malas condiciones por lo que ha tomado la decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. por este motivo acude a Ceprodel  para solicitar un crédito para Compra de materiales de construcción tales como: zinc, alfajillas de madera de pino, clavadores, clavos, zinc liso, cemento arena, piedrín y pago de mano de obra. Y por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones a su familia.
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra, le proporcionara a su familia un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Marlon works as a security guard at a medical center in the town of Telica, within the Leon department, and has done so for six years.  He’s married but doesn’t have any children.  One of his needs is to improve the condition of his home.  It’s in bad shape so he decided to begin working on it and has decided to ask for a loan through CEPRODEL, in order to buy building materials such as zinc metal sheeting, pine beams, hammers, nails, zinc bars, cement, sand, pebbles, and pay for labor.  He will be able to provide his family with better living conditions through this project.  

It’s important to stress that this project will provide his family a dignified roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Sorayda Hortensia

texts.es:
La señora Sorayda Hortensia  posee un negocio de venta de productos comidas, en  unos de los Barrios de la ciudad de león, se dedica a este negocio desde hace doce  años para  el sustento de su familia ya que es una madre soltera de un hijo. 

La señora Sorayda Hortensia se traslada al mercado a las 6:00 am  a realizar las compras para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos los cuales ofrece a su clientela, abre su negocio a la 7 am,  finalizando a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sábado y el domingo hasta el mediodía.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar zinc, perlines  la que le ayudara  a realizar   mejoras a su casa de habitación para brindarle seguridad y confort a su familia.
texts.en:
Sorayda Hortensia has a food business in one of the Leon neighborhoods.  She’s been doing this for 12 years to support her family since she’s a single mother with a son.  She goes to the market at 6:00 am to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her delicious dishes, which she offers to her customers from 7:00 am to 5:30 pm, Monday through Saturday, and until noon on Sundays.

This CEPRODEL loan will allow her to buy zinc metal sheeting and girders so she can make improvements to her home and provide more comfort and security to her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Las Optimistas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Optimistas está formado por 8 mujeres quienes laboran para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares, todas tienen una muy buena amistad y compañerismo. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que goza de un clima frió y de verdes campos, es cuna de grandes poetas y atletas, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Gladys, se encuentra desde hace 2 años en el grupo de crédito Las Optimistas, este grupo le gusta ya que todas son muy buenas amigas, al mismo tiempo que los créditos le dan la facilidad de mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia. 

La Señora. Gladys tiene 38 años de edad, es una mujer casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 17, 15, 14 y 6 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio y su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico automotriz y labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Gladys se dedica a la venta de vestidos de novias desde hace 17 años, también se dedica a la confección de una gran variedad de ropa y a la venta de cosméticos. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de vestidos de novias. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales. 

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Optimistas" is comprised of eight members who work to improve the economic stability of their homes.  They are all good friends and companions.  They live in the city of Cuenca, a place which enjoys a cool climate and green fields.  It is the birthplace of great poets and athletes, and its people maintain the culture and traditions.

One of the members of the group is Gladys who has been involved for two years with the communal bank.  She likes the group because all the members are good friends.  The loans allow her to improve her family's economic stability.

Gladys, 38, is married and has four children, ages 17, 15, 14 and 6.  The oldest three are in middle and high school and the youngest in elementary school.  Her husband is an auto mechanic and runs his own workshop.  The house they live in is their own.

Gladys has been selling bridal gowns for 17 years and she also makes a wide variety of clothing and sells cosmetics.

She plans to use the loan to buy bridal gowns.

Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

The small photo is of one of the members who could not be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy bridal gowns.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Señora Juana tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma. Hace 1 año y 6 meses estableció una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, carnes, golosinas, manteca, refrescos, pan y dulces. Con la idea de ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, Juana solicito un préstamo por la cantidad de 8000 Lempiras. Ella espera a corto plazo invertir sus ganancias en la ampliación del local, además en el futuro espera obtener un terreno que le permita construir su vivienda con mas comodidades.
texts.en: Juana, 38, is married, has two children and lives in the town of Choloma.  For a year and six months she has been running a grocery store where she sells staple goods, meat, sweets, shortening, soft drinks, bread and pastries.  In an effort to expand her business and increase sales, Juana has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 HNL.  She hopes to be able to invest her short-term earnings in the expansion of her store and also wants to buy land where she can build a more comfortable home.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, rice, meat, sweets, shortening, bread, soft drinks and pastries.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: La Señora Esmeralda, tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Villanueva. Hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas como: refrescos, churros, pan, productos de higiene y limpieza y dulces. El préstamo que solicita es por 3000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en la compra de más productos, ella considera que el préstamo le ayudara a surtir su negocio y ofrecer variedad de productos que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias. Su meta es lograr la construcción de su propio local.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 58, is a single mother of two children and lives in the town of Villanueva.  For four years she has been selling products such as soft drinks, doughnuts, bread, pastries, and personal hygiene and cleaning products.

The loan of 3,000 HNL she is requesting is to buy more products.  She believes the loan will help stock her store so she can offer more variety and increase sales and profits.  Her goal is to build her own store.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, Mwanamisi has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 20,000 KES loan, Mwanamisi wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Carmen Suyapa

texts.es: Doña Carmen, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Villanueva. Con el propósito de generar ingresos que le permitan el sustento de sus dos hijos, Carmen hace 2 años estableció  un negocio de venta de mercadería como: ropa interior, ropa para niños, sandalias y zapatos. El préstamo que solicita es por 5000 Lempiras, ella espera aumentar sus ventas ya que estará ofreciendo nuevo y variado producto. Con sus utilidades espera mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 55, is a single mother of two children and lives in the town of Villanueva.  In an effort to earn more income to support her children, two years ago Carmen established her own business selling merchandise such as underwear, children's clothing, sandals and shoes.  

The loan for 5,000 HNL she is requesting is to offer a variety of new clothing in order to increase sales.  With the profits earned she hopes to improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy underwear, children's clothing, sandals and shoes.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: La Señora Rosa, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas, ella reside en el municipio de Arizona junto a su familia. Hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de tamales, montucas y pastelitos, dichos productos son elaborados a base de maíz tierno. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de 3500 Lempiras los cuales va invertir en la compra de pollo, elotes (maíz tierno) y condimentos etc. Ella considera que el préstamo le ayudara a incrementar la producción de tamales y cubrir la demanda que actualmente tiene. Su meta es invertir parte de sus ganancias en algunas mejoras a la vivienda.
texts.en: Rosa, 50, is a single mother of two daughters and lives in the town of Arizona with her family.  For five years she has been telling tamales, montucas (sweetcorn tamales) and little pies.  She makes the products out of sweetcorn.   She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 3,500 HNL to buy chicken, sweetcorn and seasonings, etc.  She believes the loan will help increase production of tamales to cover the current demand.  Her goal is to invest part of her earnings in home renovation.

loans.use: To buy chicken, sweetcorn and seasonings.

loans.name: María Lilian

texts.es: María trabaja como empleada doméstica, contando con muy buenas referencias ya que es muy confiable. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad que se dedican a estudiar. María solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar los materiales de construcción para elaborar una fosa séptica en su casa y así mismo comprar un baño y colocarlo en la nueva fosa séptica, esto le brindará mayor comodidad a María y su familia.
texts.en: Maria works as a domestic employee, is trustworthy, and has good references.  She lives with her husband and two children who attend school.  Maria is asking for a loan through FUSAI, so she can buy building materials for a septic tank in her home.  She also wants to buy a toilet.  This will provide better comfort to Maria and her family.

loans.use: to build a septic system.

loans.name: Claudia Elizabeth

texts.es: Claudia es una persona muy dedicada a su hogar quien siempre desea salir adelante, ella es soltera y vive junto a su única hija de once años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. Claudia desea poder construir un cuarto en su casa, para poder contar con más espacio para ella y su hija, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, por medio del cual pueda comprar materiales como block,  arena y cemento y de esta forma  realizar el sueño de ampliar un poco más su casa.
texts.en: Claudia is a dedicated person who always wants to come out ahead.  She is single and lives with her only daughter; she’s eleven years old and attends school.  Claudia wants to build a room onto her house so she can have more room for herself and for her daughter.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can buy building materials such as cinder blocks, sand, and cement and in this way be able to expand her house a bit more.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario vive junto a su compañero de vida y dos hijos de tres y ocho años de edad. Ella desea poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa, realizando algunos mantenimientos y reparaciones, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a FUSAI para poder invertir en la compra de balcones para colocar en las ventanas, así mismo para comprar materiales como: cemento, ladrillo y arena para reparar la pila y construir un baño en su casa.
texts.en: Rosario lives with her life’s partner and two children, ages three and eight.  She wants to improve her home, make some repairs, and do some maintenance, so she is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can buy window sills.  She also wants to buy building materials such as cement, bricks, sand, and make repairs to a pillar and build a bathroom.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Josefina Idalia

texts.es: Josefina, es una joven que trabaja de oficios domésticos y a su vez estudia para ser profesora ya que tiene grandes deseos de salir adelante, ella es soltera y vive junto a su familia. Josefina para apoyar a su familia solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, así poder construir un baño de fosa séptica, esto debido a que el actual ha culminado su vida útil por lo que es necesario construir uno nuevo, y así mismo invertirá en la compra de un baño lavable para colocarlo sobre la nueva fosa.
texts.en: Josefina is a young lady who works domestically and is studying to become a teacher.  She has a great desire to get ahead.  She is single and lives with her family.  Josefina is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can build a septic tank.  The current one has reached the end of its useful life and she needs to build a new one.  She will also buy a new toilet.

loans.use: to buy a septic tank.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, quien se encarga de elaborar comida típica para vender. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. Reyna desea mucho poder construir en su casa un lavadero y un baño sanitario nuevo, por lo que solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, para poder contar con el dinero necesario para realizar la compra de los materiales de construcción necesarios, como ladrillo, arena y cemento y de este modo poder realizar la obra.
texts.en: Reyna is a responsible and hardworking mother. She works preparing traditional foods to sell. She lives together with her husband and two underage children. Reyna dreams of building a washing room and a new bathroom at home, and this is why she is requesting a loan at FUSAI. She needs money to buy construction supplies such as bricks, sand and cement in order to start the works.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand and cement to build a washing room and a bathroom.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and married with two children. She sells electrical goods as well as running a mobile money transfer business. She has been in this business for 3 years. Her husband also provides additional income in support of the family.

She plans to use the loan to purchase more electrical appliances and a photocopier machine. This is her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use the generated profits to open up another electrical shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to grow her business and become a great supplier of electrical goods and electronics.

loans.use: To add stock of electrical goods and a photocopier machine.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
La señora Santa de 48 años, vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 07  años a la venta de verduras como ser cebolla, tomate, chile dulce, repollo, papas, Lechuga, limones y todo tipo de frutas.
Doña Santa sale a vender a diferentes lugares y cuenta con que un carro en donde se transporta a las distintas zonas de su comunidad para  vender junto con su esposo. 
Doña Santa está solicitando  el préstamo para comprar de cebollas, tomates, yucas, chiles verde, plátanos, papas, repollo, etc.  Y salir a vender junto con su esposo, está muy contenta de poder seguir trabajando con Prisma ya que su negocio ha aumentado con el crédito que se le otorgo.
Doña Santa su sueño es poder mejorar mas su casa de habitación.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Santa, 48, lives together with her husband in a house located in a village in San Lorenzo, Valle, Southern Honduras. She has been selling vegetables for seven years (e.g. onion, tomato, sweet chili, cabbage, potato, lettuce, lemon and all kinds of fruits).

Santa works as a street vendor. She has a car in which she travels to the different corners of her community and sells together with her husband.

Santa is requesting a loan to buy onions, tomatoes, cassavas, green chilies, plantains, potatoes, cabbages, etc., in order to sell them with her husband. She feels happy to be able to continue working with Prisma, since her business grew with the loan she received.

Santa’s dream is to make some home improvements.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2013

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Mwanaidi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking  oil.

loans.name: Bait Al-Matry Group

texts.en:
This group is called Bait Al-Matry and it consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Fatima is a 43-year-old married woman with five children who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is hardworking housewife and tries to provide for her family. She has a small house and she doesn`t have money to get house improvements. So she is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER  to buy furniture to use for her home. She hopes in the future to complete building her house to provide a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for her home.

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is a very hardworking woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanauba operates a cafe business where she makes various food like beans, rice, tea, chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
The members of Elizabeth's Group are located in Dansoman-Accra, Ghana.

Elizabeth is 28 years old, single, and she has no child. She has been selling wigs for 8 years now. She is single and preparing for marriage; therefore, she has to work hard to be able to become a good wife and also to sustain her expenses currently. Things are going well for her business, and she gets her goods from the central market. Her dream is to expand her shop so she can sell more wigs, and is asking for a loan amount of 2000 GHS to help reach this goal.

The other member of the group is Anthony. He sells home appliances, and together they need 4800 GHS to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy wigs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 41 years old, married to Naini and they have seven children who are in school.

He has been in the farming business in Naivasha for 20 years and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to purchase fertilizer and seeds. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, he hopes to be among the top farmers in his area.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Flaciah

texts.en:
Flaciah is 34 years old and married to Shadrack. They are blessed with four children. 

Fleciah has been in the construction business for the last four years with a monthly income of KES 25,000. She qualified for her second loan with KADET Ltd. of KES 20,000 with which she plans to expand her place of work.

With the anticipated profit she will build her own plot. Her dream is to support her family and educate her children.

loans.use: To expand her place of work.

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is a very hardworking woman who is the mother of three children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Mebakari operates a dairy farm, and she sells milk to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase storage facilities for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase storage facilities for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 44 years old, married and a father of three children. 

For the last 14 years, he has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 

John was introduced to KADET Ltd. by our credit officer, and he is applying for his third loan of KES 60,000, to buy seeds, some fertilizer and other farm inputs needed for his business. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as to expand his farming activities. His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing his income so as to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase farming inputs like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a single businesswoman and she has been in the clothes business for the last two years. She started the business with her own savings and the business has grown since then. 

She knew Milango through friends and she seeks a loan to buy cloth materials to sell in the business. In future, she will want to diversify into a vegetable business. The challenges she faces in the business include high fuel costs and transportation problems. The extra income she will raise from the business will increase her personal savings.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials.

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a business of selling leso (women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 40 pieces of leso for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of leso for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married and has three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and diseases affecting her poultry.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks, chicken feeds and vaccine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, chicken feeds and vaccine.

loans.name: Rubymae

texts.en:
Rubymae is in her third year of study at Misamis University, Ozamiz City, for her BS in medtech. 

Her mother is a government employee and her father is earning from his pension. She joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 14,000 PHP to cover the costs of school tuition fees for her first semester. 

In the future, she wants to finish her study, get a job related to her course, and be able to help her parents.

loans.use: to cover the costs of school tuition fees for her first semester.

loans.name: Sasini

texts.en:
Sasini is 30 years old and supporting a family of five members. He has been farming for 10 years with a monthly income of 80,000 KES.

Sasini is requesting his fourth loan from KADET LTD for 60,000 KES, which he will use to purchase more livestock and other farm inputs. With the anticipated profit, he will expand his business and earn a bigger profit.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar variedad de ropa, tales como: blusas, faldas, vestidos y ropa interior para damas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y obtuvo mayores ingresos pero las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Ana needs to request a new loan now that she requires more working capital to invest in her business. She will buy assorted clothes, such as blouses, skirts, dresses and women underwear.

The previous loan helped her to fulfill her customers’ needs and receive a higher income. The conditions at home remain the same.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses and women underwear.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is married and has five children. She lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She owns a retail shop that sells motorbike spare parts. 

Winnie is requesting her second loan, which she will use to buy motorcycle spare parts. She also wants to buy soft drinks. The challenges in her business are price changes and inflation.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma makes snacks such as samosas. She uses green grams (mung beans) to make her samosas and sells them to passersby and neighbors.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase additional food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, and green grams. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, and green grams (mung beans).

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 26 years old and supports a seven-year-old child. For the past year she has been selling shoes. Lilian earns 14,000 KES each month.

Lilian is requesting a 10,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to purchase shoes to sell. This is her first loan. She plans to use the anticipated profit from her loan to expand her business. In the future, Lilian dreams of having a successful business.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Victory Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Beatrice was born in Sewafeh, in eastern Sierra Leone, 35 years ago. She is married to a teacher, and the couple has four children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. For four years now, Beatrice has been selling cooking oil, rice, tomatoes, etc.
 
This is first the loan that Beatrice and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. Beatrice will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL [Sierra Leone leones]) to expand her business; she will buy cooking oil, rice, tomatoes, etc., wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, tomatoes, etc., wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Kantati * 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento KANTATI * 26,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes cinco mujeres y tres varones,   la presidenta del banco la  Sra. Lucila tiene 56 años, tiene  dos hijos ya mayores de edad la  Sra. Lucila se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Lucila va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la  Sra. Lucila va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, la  Sra. Lucila es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en: The Entrepreneurship Bank KANTATI * 26 is composed of eight members: five women and three men. The bank president Lucila is 56 years old and has two adult children. Lucila sells a variety of essential items such as groceries and various other items in her neighbourhood store. This loan is their first within the institution. Lucila will use this loan to purchase variety of groceries to stock her business, such as wholesale rice, noodles, flour and sugar and thus provide variety of products to their customers. Their reason for applying for this loan is to keep improving their business. Lucila will use the profits to continue purchasing products, thereby improving their income. Lucila is a very hardworking person, and feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support given to her and her team members.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale groceries

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Mr Kodzo a démarré depuis 2012 la vente des produits d'alimentation générale. Âgé de 31ans, il est marié et père d'un enfant de 02ans. Son second crédit lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo, age 31, is the married father of a 2-year-old child. To support his family, he started to sell general food products in 2012. 

This second loan will help him to bolster his stock of merchandise and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and improve her living standards, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fish for resale. She is grateful for the new support she has received that will boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулуу 63 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Айсулуу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айсулуу занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 40,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулуу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 дойных коров, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсулуу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айсулуу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Aisuluu is a 63-year-old widow. After the death of her husband, she was left to raise three children on her own, and similarly to run their farm. Aisuluu has a high school education. As the main source of income for her family, Aisuluu is involved in raising livestock, starting six years ago with the purchase of livestock for 40,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Aisuluu now has on her farm: seven dairy cows and 25 sheep. The monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her farm, Aisuluu turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 125,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the count of livestock. 

Aisuluu plans to invest income from the loan to further augment the quantity of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Aqeed

texts.en:
Aqeed is a 27-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is very hardworking and does his best to improve his living. Aqeed studied at the university level. He works selling phone accessories to earn a low salary which is hardly enough to pay rent on a small house. Aqeed never depends on anyone and always does as much he can to earn money for his daily expenses.

Aqeed is requesting a 300,000 YER youth loan to buy some furniture for his house. In the future, he hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
This is Rodolfo. His previous loan was a big help in his business and he was able to buy more products for his rolling store. Rodolfo’s loan is also helping with the education of his children and to cover his everyday home expenses. 

Rodolfo is requesting another 30,000 PHP to pay for additional products such as toys and household products like pails, basins, dippers, and other products needed for his rolling store. More items to sell will result in better profit which will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and provide for educational expenses of his children. Rodolfo looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. In the future, he hopes to have another rolling store and to have employees and he dreams of giving his children a good and quality education. Rodolfo meets up weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy toys and household products such as pails, basins, and dippers for his rolling store

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a hardworking and enterprising woman. For the past two years, she has operated a general store where she sells to her neighbors and passersby. Mishi owns a house with electricity and running water. Her major business challenges are seasonality and theft. Mishi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mishi is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase maize flour, soap, cooking oil, rice, beans and other items. In the future, she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, soap, cooking oil, rice, beans and other items

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and green peas. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and green peas

loans.name: Lira

texts.ru: Лира 43 года, разведена, имеет 2 детей. У Лиры средне-специальное образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Лира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2008 года занимается торговлей продуктов питания, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сом KGS. Магазин у нее собственный, реализует продукты питания. Благодаря упорному труду Лиры, она смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Лире расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Лира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 83,000 сом (KGS) на покупку оптовых продуктов питания для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита помогут Лире увеличить товарооборот в продуктовом магазине, а также полученная прибыль поможет растить и обучить детей в хороших условиях.
texts.en:
Lira is 43 years old, divorced, and has two children. Lira has a specialized high school education. She has very good reviews from her neighbors. They speak of her as a kind and hardworking woman. As the main source of income for the family, Lira has since 2008 been involved in trade of food products, having started this business with 20,000 som (KGS). She has her own shop where she sells food products. Thanks to her hard work, Lira was able to develop and grow her business. Her activities bring in about 15,000 som KGS per month, which is the basis for food and household expenses. Income from the business allowed Lira to expand her inventory. 

With the aim of further developing her business, Lira turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 83,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of wholesale food products for resale. Income from the loan will help Lira to increase trade in the grocery store, and the resulting profit will help to raise and educate the children in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid lives in the Kongowea area in Kenya. He is 38 years old, a married man, and a father of four children. He has been running a retail business for the last seven years that has been feeding him and his family. 

He knew of Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan to buy sugar, flour and salt for the business. He has a vision of opening a wholesale business in the next five years. The major challenges in the business are competition and funding. The extra income that he will raise from this loan will pay school fees for his children and provide good health for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and salt.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman, with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. 

Elizabeth has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years. Her potential customers are local women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the KSH 30,000 she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.
