Young Durqui, 23, lives with her mother in a house located in a village in San Lorenzo, Valle, in southern Honduras.  She’s worked for the last six years selling tortillas; she also sells snacks and tamales.

Durqui sells her products every day in the evenings.  She’s a woman who is very dedicated to her work and helps her mother with the income she earns from her sales.

Durqui’s asking for a loan to buy corn, firewood, lime powder, meat, leaves for the tamales, etc., all products she needs to make tortillas and tamales.  She hopes this investment will allow her to earn the income needed to continue supporting her mother and family.  Durqui’s dream is to continue growing with her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- August, 2013.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es: Junto con toda su familia Ciro se dedica a la producción de café desde hace mucho tiempo. Sus hijos le ayudan en las fincas y durante la época de cosecha hasta su esposa se va a trabajar al campo para darse abasto con todas las actividades que deben hacer en la finca. El café que producen es de excelente calidad y entregan en su totalidad su cosecha año con año a la “Unión Regional” para que sea procesada y exportada. Para esta cosecha Ciro necesita un crédito el cual utilizará para compra de fertilizantes y en caso de ser necesario contratar algunos cortadores que le ayuden cuando hay más trabajo por realizar. Aunque el café es su principal ingreso, Ciro también se dedica a la siembra de hoja de plátano y de esta forma puede aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Cirio and his entire family have worked growing coffee for a long time.  His children help him in the groves and during harvest time even his wife heads out to the fields so that he can get all the necessary tasks done on the farm.  

The coffee they produce is excellent quality and they deliver it in its entirety to “Unión Regional” [coffee cooperative] to be processed and exported.  Cirio needs a loan for the current crop that he’ll use to buy fertilizer and if necessary to hire some pickers to help him when there is more work to be done.  Although coffee is his main source of income, Cirio also grows banana leaves to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to hire coffee pickers.

loans.name: Sara Guadalupe

texts.es:
Sara, vive con su familia en casa propia, su madre y sus dos hijos. Ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante  y su madre le ayuda en la casa, dicha actividad la realiza todos los días como una fuente de ingresos.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar variedad de mercadería, tales como: camisas juveniles, calzonetas, calcetines y ropa interior; esta inversión le servirá para surtir su negocio y ofrecerle mejor calidad de mercadería a sus clientes.
Su sueño es optimizar su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sara lives with her family, her mother and two children, in a house of her own.  She works selling clothes from place to place and her mother helps her at home.  She does this work every day as a source of income.

The loan she needs will make it possible for her to buy merchandise like children’s shirts, underwear, socks and shorts.  This investment will help her stock her business and offer better quality merchandise to her customers.  Her dream is to optimize her business and to hear higher profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Egla

texts.es:
La joven Egla, de 25  años vive con su mama en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 03  años a la venta de queso, cuajada y mantequilla.
Egla compra la leche y prepara los lácteos y luego sale a vender todos los días, ya que tiene sus clientes que le encargar estos productos a diario. 
Egla está solicitando  el préstamo para comprar de más leche, pastillas, etc. productos para elaborar sus lácteos, espera que esta inversión le ayude a obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos y apoyar a su familia.
Egla su sueño es comprarse una motocicleta para salir a vender a otros lugares.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Young Egla, 25, lives with her mother in her house located in a village in San Lorenzo, Valle, in southern Honduras.  She’s sold cheese, curd and butter for three years.

Egla buys milk and makes the dairy products to go out to sell every day since her customers order these products daily.

Egla’s asking for a loan to buy milk, rennet, etc. that are products she needs to make dairy products.  She hopes this investment will help her earn income needed to cover her expenses and to support her family.  Egla’s dream is to buy a motorcycle to go sell her products in other places.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – August, 2013.

loans.use: to buy milk, rennet, etc.

loans.name: Julio Ernesto

texts.es:
Julio, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su actividad de transporte de carga; esta inversión le ayudara para darle mantenimiento al vehículo.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar las condiciones del carro, asimismo las circunstancias económicas y familiares se han superado.
texts.en: Julio needs to opt for a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue providing cargo hauling services.  This investment will help him service his vehicle.  His previous loan helped him improve his car’s condition.  Similarly, his economic and familial circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Jaylyn

texts.en: Jaylyn is studying business administration at Stella Maris College. Her father is a laborer in town while her mother is earning with her buy-and-sell business selling fruits in the market. Jaylyn's greatest ambition is to finish her studies and get a job in the future. So without hesitation, she borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she had joined recently, to buy school supplies like books, uniforms and many other items. Jaylyn hopes to improve the general living condition of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy school supplies like books, uniforms and other items

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Carmen, vive con su familia, su madre y su abuela quienes le ayudan a atender el negocio, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de lácteos para obtener ingresos.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar diversidad de mercadería, tales como: queso duro, queso blando, crema, cuajada, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a tener surtido de productos y así cubrir la demanda de los clientes.
Su sueño es aumentar en su negocio las ventas y así crecer.
texts.en:
Carmen lives with her family, her mother and grandmother, who help her tend to her business since she works selling dairy products to earn income.

The loan she’s requesting will make it possible for her to buy assorted merchandise like hard cheese, soft cheese, cream and curd, among others.  This investment will help her have a good variety of products in stock to cover customer demand.  Her dream is to increase her business and to grow that way.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a su  negocio de venta y compra de artesania,la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende muñecas, chompas, telares entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas de alpaca.

La socia está agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The client continues with her business buying and selling crafts.    She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells dolls, sweaters and woven textiles, among others.  She wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family this way.  She requests the loan to buy alpaca sweaters.  She’s grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters.

loans.name: Sabine Marie Hortense

texts.fr: Marie une dame âgée de 45 ans,mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est commerçante et dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la ville de 02 ans environ. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. mais son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui est parfois obligée de se retourner vers la concurrence. Ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital .elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boisson  afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice et lui permettra aussi d'être en règle dans son commerce. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille. elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en:
Marie is 45 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She has been a shopkeeper selling carryout items in a neighborhood of her city for about the last two years. She has the benefit of good experience in the business, but her current amount of capital no longer allows her to meet all the demands of her customers who are sometimes forced to go to the competition.

Because of this lack of business capital, Marie would like this loan to increase her stock of beverages in order to meet the demands of her customers. This will also allow her to increase her profits and turnover and will allow her to keep her business in good standing. The profits generated will allow her to better meet the needs of her family. Marie's ambition for her business is to become a beverage wholesaler.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beverages

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana, a sus 21 años de edad, es casada desde hace 7 meses y actualmente se dedica a laborar como asesora comercial en un reconocido almacén de ropa; desde hace 4 meses alterna su empleo ayudándole a una amiga a vender ropa americana y le ha ido muy bien, por lo que desea iniciar esta actividad pero con sus propios recursos para generar ingresos adicionales que le permitan apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. La cliente es una joven emprendedora, activa y se proyecta hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos, esto la lleva a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, chaquetas, camisas, entre otros), así podrá aprovechar la oportunidad que le brinda el almacén donde trabaja ya que puede comprar mercancía a precio de costo, lo que le permitirá mejorar el margen de utilidades que recibe por la venta de los productos y, de esta forma Ana podrá seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta que es consolidar y fortalecer su negocio para que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, que le genere una estabilidad económica favorable para seguir aportando a la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
At the age of 21, Ana has been married for seven months and is working as a commercial consultant at a well-known clothing store.  For the last four months she’s been alternating her job with helping a friend sell American clothes and she’s done very well which is why she now wants to go into this business with her own resources to earn extra income to help her husband with the household expense.

The client is a young, active entrepreneur who is focused on reaching her goals.  This has led her to request a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale (blouses, jeans, jackets, shirts, etc.) to take advantage of an opportunity the store that employs her is giving her to buy merchandise at a low price which will allow her to improve her profit margin when she sells the goods.  In this way, Ana will be able to continue making progress towards reaching her main goal of consolidating and strengthening her business so that it becomes profitable and long-lasting, that it generates favorable economic stability so she can continue contributing towards her home’s economy.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Veronica tiene 24 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad de Patria junto con su pareja y sus dos hijos, ella es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la agricultura entonces cosecha hojas de coca. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Patria es una ciudad de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
Verónica, 24, lives in the beautiful city of Patria with her spouse and two children. She’s an enterprising, hardworking person who gets ahead with much effort and dedication.  Her main economic activity is agriculture; she grows coca leaf.  She’s been in this business for several years and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She belongs to the “Señor de Huanca de Patria” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy manure thus increasing her working capital in this line of work.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

(The town of Patria stands out as a commercial center for jungle products as well as for lodging services and restaurants.  Patria is a gateway city of Manu National Park.)

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Mariela Lourdes

texts.es: Mariela tiene 21 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad de Patria junto con su pareja y su única hija, ella es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la agricultura entonces cosecha hojas de coca. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Patria es una ciudad de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
Mariela, 21, lives in the beautiful city of Patria with her spouse and only daughter.  She’s an enterprising, hardworking person who gets ahead with much effort and dedication.  Her main economic activity is agriculture; she grows coca leaf.  She’s been in this business for many years and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She belongs to the “Señor de Huanca de Patria” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy fertilizer thus increasing her working capital in this line of work.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

(The town of Patria stands out as a commercial center for jungle products as well as for lodging services and restaurants.  Patria is a gateway city of Manu National Park.)

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario es una madre muy responsable quien debe trabajar muy duro para poder sostener a sus tres hijos, debido a que ella es madre soltera. Rosario solicita un  préstamo a FUSAI, para poder construir su cocina, debido a que actualmente no posee una habitación solo para esto, lo que es algo incómodo e inseguro para sus hijos. Es por esto que ella comprará polines, acero, láminas y cemento para poder construir el área necesaria donde colocar ahí la cocina, con lo que contará con una mejor división en su hogar.
texts.en: Rosario is a very responsible mother who must work very hard to be able to support her three children, since she is a single mother.  Rosario is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can build a kitchen since she doesn’t have one and it’s uncomfortable and insecure for her children.  She will buy beams, steel bars, metal, and cement so she can build her kitchen.  This will make her home better.

loans.use: to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 64 años de edad, actualmente esta casado,  tiene 2 hijos y 4 nietos que viven junto con él, ya que el papá de los niños los abandonó y se encuentran estudiando en el caserío y uno de sus hijos que ya esta por culminar el bachillerato.
Miguel se dedica a la agricultura desde los 12 años, cuando su padre suyo, lo ponía  a trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos. También, antes cultivó hortalizas y algunos frutales, como caña de azúcar, mango, etc. El trabajo se encuentra ubicado a una distancia de 50mt, eso le facilita la llegada al cultivo.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 sacos de abono, 3 litros de herbicidas y pagar mano de obra para la siembra de frijol. 
Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda, ya que expresó que quiere construirla de otro material.
texts.en:
Miguel, 64, is a married man with two children and four grandchildren living with him since the children’s father abandoned them.  They attend the local school and one of his sons is about to finish high-school.

Miguel has worked in agriculture since the age of 12 when  his father put him to work growing basic grains.  He also used to grow vegetables and fruit like sugarcane, mango, etc.  His place of work is located at a distance of 50 meters which makes his parcel easy to reach.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three sacks of manure, three liters of herbicide and to pay labor costs to plant beans.  His dream is to improve his house since he mentioned that he’s like to build it with different materials.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Eufrasio

texts.es: Eufracio tiene 50 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad de Patria junto con su pareja y tiene seis hijos, él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la construcción de obras. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como pinturas, arena, cemento y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Patria es una ciudad de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
Eufracio, 50, lives in the beautiful city of Patria with his spouse; he has 6 children.  He’s an enterprising, hardworking person who gets ahead with much effort and dedication.  His main economic activity is construction work.  He’s been in this business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort he puts into it.

He belongs to the “Señor Huanca de Patria” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy building supplies like paint, sand and cement to increase working capital in this line of work.  He’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

(The town of Patria is noted as a commercial center for jungle products as well as for lodging services and restaurants.  Patria is a gateway city to Manu National Park.)

loans.use: to buy natural products like paint, sand and cement.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 24-year-old, married Palestinian refugee who has worked as a car mechanic for seven years.

In 2008, he started his own business to improve his living. Rabih is well-known in his region for his special talent and his prices. 

He is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to renew his tools and to continue pasting floor tiles at his house.

Rabih hopes to keep on developing his business and open a larger workshop in the future, outside the camp where he was born, lives, and works.

loans.use: to renew his tools and to continue pasting floor tiles at his house.

loans.name: Iveth Magadalena

texts.es:
La  Señora  Iveth de 28 años, vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de el Jícaro Galán, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de refrescos y  comidas como ser sopas marineras, carne asadas, tacos, enchiladas, hamburguesas, etc. 
Doña Iveth  tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa, donde sus clientes son amigos y personas que transitan por su casa. 
Doña Iveth  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pan, carne, lechuga, queso, frijoles, arroz, refrescos, etc. para la elaboración de diferentes comidas para la venta  porque quiere ampliar su negocio en donde quiere meter productos lácteos y así surtir más su negocio,  ya que se los están dando a buen precio y son de buena calidad, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende suplir su necesidad financiera. 
Doña Iveth su sueño es compra un carro para poder transportase a comprar sus mercadería 

San Lorenzo, Honduras –  Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Iveth, 28, lives with her husband in her house located in a community in El Jícaro, Galán, in southern Honduras.  For several years she’s been selling snacks and meals like seafood soup, grilled meat, tacos, enchiladas, hamburgers, etc.  Iveth’s business is home-based and her customers tend to be friends and people who pass by her house.

Iveth’s asking for a loan to buy bread, meat, lettuce, cheese, beans, rice, soft-drinks, etc. to prepare the various dishes she sells because she wants to expand the business introducing dairy products to better stock it since they are being offered to her  at a good price and they are very good quality.  With the loan’s support she intends to fill her financial need.  Iveth’s dream is to buy a car to transport herself to do her purchasing.

San Lorenzo, Honduras –  August, 2013.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: Benito tiene 38 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad de Patria junto con su pareja y tiene cuatro hijos, él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la construcción de obras y tambien tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Patria es una ciudad de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en: Benito is 38 years old and he lives in the beautiful city of Patria with his partner and he has four children.  He is an enterprising and hardworking person who gets ahead through a lot of effort and dedication, as his main source of income is construction and he also has a grocery store.  He has been in this business for several years now and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  He belongs to the Señor de Huanca de Patria Communal Bank and this time he needs a loan to buy essential items, such as rice, sugar, and noodles, which will increase his working capital in this field.  He is thankful for and appreciative of this loan and he promises to make his monthly payments very responsibly.  (The town of Patria is known for selling products from the jungle as well as for its lodging and restaurants.  The city of Patria is a gateway to Manú National Park.)

loans.use: to buy essential items, such as rice, sugar, and noodles

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Joséphine est une femme mariée de 32 ans mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 8 et 11 ans, les deux vont à l'école. elle avait ouvert et gère un petit atelier de couture mélangé d'une mercerie dans quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans déjà. son activité fonctionne grâce à son savoir faire, son expérience qui lui permis d'agrandir  clientèle au fil du temps. Elle aimerai acheter à nouveau le matériel de couture en gros pour remplir sa petite mercerie (bobine de de fil, tissus, aiguilles fermetures)et détailler à ses clients. ceci l'aidera aussi pour la confection de des vêtement qu'elle coud pour revendre. Elle aimerai économiser le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour aider son époux avec une partie de la scolarité de leurs enfants et garder le reste parce qu'elle aimerai ouvrir un autre atelier.
texts.en: Josephine is a 32 year old married woman with two children, aged between 8 and 11 years. Both go to school. She opened and has run a small sewing shop mixed with a dry goods store in an area of the city for three years already. Her business works thanks to her knowledge and her experience which has allowed her to increase her customer base with time. She would like to buy sewing material wholesale to stock her little dry goods shop (bobbins of thread, fabric, needles, clasps) and sell retail to her customers. This will also help her for the clothing that she sews to resell. She would like to save the profits that this loan will bring her to help her husband with a portion of the education of their children and keep the rest because she would like to open another studio.

loans.use: to buy everyday items for sewing

loans.name: Sabenty United Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sabenty United” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Abass.  Abass is age 30; he was born in Marampa village, in northern Sierra Leone, but he is currently residing in Waterloo, together with his wife and six children. His wife is a trader, and two of his children are attending primary schools. 

For five years now, Abass has been selling “coal-pots” (locally made stoves). With this loan, he is going to buy dozens of coal-pots to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of coal-pots to add to his business.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 30-year-old, married man who has been working as a car mechanic for 17 years. He is a hard worker who's known by his special talent and services in his domain.

Jamal is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy a large quantity of car oil and to start selling, as an additional income.

He is so excited and optimistic about this loan because he's sure that it will provide him with a good income and will attract new customers. He hopes that, in the future, he might start trading with this oil by selling it wholesale.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of car oil.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cassava, plantain and oil in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. 

Aba is married and has three children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cassava, plantain and oil. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cassava, plantain and oil.

loans.name: Union De Cabecera Group

texts.es: El grupo Unión de Cabecera está integrado por seis integrantes es un grupo muy chiquito pero la unión entre ellos los caracteriza, El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque ´precisamente ellos querían seria un grupo unido, pero también lleva el nombre de la comunidad donde viven. Doña Manuela es una mujer muy trabajadora ella tiene 69 años de edad esta casada con el señor Miguel desde hace varios años Don Manuel ya no trabaja solo atiende el sistema del agua potable, juntos han formado una familia con nueve hijos de los cuales se encuentra estudiando su educación secundaria. Doña Manuela se dedica a la venta de elotes y esquites los vende afuera de su casa platica que solo necesita poner una pequeña mesita chica y una lona para iniciar con la venta de sus elotes solo vende los fines de semana viernes, sábados y domingos aprovecha estos días porque son los días que vende mas con la actividad lleva ya 6 años. Doña Manuela platica “Anteriormente yo no tenia idea de como se preparaban estos antojitos mexicanos el negocio era de mi hija pero ella tuvo que dejarlo para irse a trabajara a la ciudad de Mexico, pero como vi cuanta clientela tenia ya mi hija decidi continuar yo” Doña Manuela esta muy agradecida con con KIVA y Vision Fund porque cuando inicio con la venta de sus elotes y esquites solo podia vender 50 elotes el dinero no le alcanzaba para comprar, sin embargo se entero de los créditos fue como decidió solicitar una poco a poco sus ventas han ido aumentando ahora  llega a vender hasta 100 elotes, a sus esquites les agrede patitas de pollo todo esto lo logro con el apoyo y el gran esfuerzo de Doña Manuela. Ella comenta: “No tengo ninguna dificultad estoy muy contenta con mi negocio porque no necesito grandes esfuerzos para realizarlo, también porque ya soy una mujer mayor y ya no puedo encontrar trabajo fácilmente y con la venta de mis elotes y esquites puedo asegurar mi futuro” Doña Manuela además de las ventas de elotes y esquites también se dedica a criar animalitos para despues venderlos como pollos, guajolotes, patos y cerditos. La sueño de Doña Manuela es poder tener un local donde pueda vender sus antojitos mexicanos porque en la calle ya no es muy seguro vender. Los integrantes del grupo también tiene grandes sueños de la misma manera solicitan su crédito para invertir en sus negocios y asi poder poder lograr sus metas, Silvia, Doña Ángela e Imelda invertirán en su tienda de abarrotes, Josefa y Flora en cerdos y Juan invertirá en guajolotes.
texts.en:
The “Unión de Cabecera” group consists of six members.  It’s a very small group but they are noted for the unity among them.  They chose the group name precisely because they wanted it to be a united group but also because it’s the name of the community they live in.

Manuela, 69, is a very hardworking woman.  She’s been married to Miguel for many years.  He hasn’t worked for several years and only takes care of the drinking water system now.  They have formed a family of nine children together some of which are attending secondary school.

Manuela works making grilled corn and popcorn to sell outside her house.  She relates that all she has to do is set up a small table and a tarp to start selling the corn.  She only sells weekends on Friday, Saturday and Sunday.  She takes advantage of these days because that’s when she sells the most;  she’s been in business six years now.

Manuela says: “Previously I had no idea how this type of Mexican snack food was made.  The business belonged to my daughter but she had to leave it to go work in Mexico City.  But when I saw the large clientele she had I decided to continue with it myself.”  Manuela is very grateful to Kiva and to VisionFund because when she started selling the corn and popcorn she could only sell 50 because her money didn’t stretch any further than that to buy more.  However, she found out about the loans and that’s how she decided to request one.  Little by little her sales have increased and now she sells 100.  She adds chicken legs to her corn and was able to accomplish this thanks to the support and to her great effort.

She comments: “I have no difficulty and am very happy with my business because I don’t have to make much of an effort to carry it out.  Also, because I’m an older woman I could no longer find employment easily and by selling corn and popcorn I’m able to insure my future.”  

In addition to the corn and popcorn sales, Manuela also raises small animals like chickens, turkeys, ducks and piglets to sell.  Her dream is to be able to have a locale in which to sell her Mexican snacks because it isn’t too safe to sell in the street any more.

The other group members also have great dreams and are requesting their loans to invest in their businesses to reach their goals.  Silvia, Ángela and Imelda will invest in their grocery stores, Josefa and Flora will invest in pigs and Juan will invest in turkeys.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Recho

texts.en:
Recho  is a 58-year-old farmer, and widowed. She is also a mother of four children.

Recho has been managing the family tea plantation for the last six years, making a monthly income of KES 35,000. She has been advanced her 2nd loan of KES 20,000 after successfully paying off the first.

She will use the funds to pay the workers in the farm as well as buy fertilizers for the plantation. The proceeds will be used to cater to the family's basic needs.

She dreams of becoming an accomplished business lady.

loans.use: to manage her tea plantation

loans.name: Reyna Elizeth

texts.es:
La  Joven Reyna de 22 años, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en un  Barrio de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05 años a la venta de  calzado como ser tenis, sandalias plataformas, tacos de futbol, tenis de niño, zapatos colegiales, etc.
Reyna tiene su puesto del mercado municipal en donde llega a vender todos los días de la semana y sus clientes son las personas que transitan por el mercado así como sus amigos y vecinos de la zona donde vive. 
Reyna está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de zapatos de colegio, tenis, sandalias, tacos, sandalias, etc.  Para tener más mercadería y surtir mas su negocio y así salir a vender ya que quiere aprovechar la temporada de las fiestas patrias.
Reyna su sueño es ampliar mas su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Reyna is 22 years old. She lives in the Barrio of San Lorenzo, which in the southern zone of Honduras. She has spent 5 years selling footwear like tennis shoes, platform sandals, soccer cleats, children's sneakers, school shoes etc. 

Reyna has her post in the municipal market where people come to sell their products every day of the week. Her customers are people who pass through the market with their friends and neighbors from the area they live in.  

Reyna is requesting this loan to buy school shoes, tennis shoes, sandals, cleats, and others to have more merchandise and to expand her business.  In this way she can sell what she wants to take advantage of the holiday season. 

Her dream is to expand her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2013

loans.use: to buy school shoes, tennis shoes, sandals, cleats, etc. for her business

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna is married with seven children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Kuvuna has operated a fruits and vegetables stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 25,000 Kenya Shillings, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Willian Alex

texts.es:
Willian de 42 años de edad, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logro estudiar hasta bachillerato,  a partir de ese momento, comenzó con el aprendizaje de mecánica automotriz,  con especialidad en enderezado  y pintura. En  ese tiempo conoció a su pareja  con la que se casó  y actualmente tienen  un hijo de 13 años que estudia  8° grado de educación básica; Su esposa administra un cafetín en el mercado, con lo que apoya con los gastos familiares.  

Don Willian es propietario de un taller de enderezado  y pintura, en la ciudad. Comenzando este trabajo hace 25 años en la capital del país, donde aprendió el oficio y con el correr de los años se estableció en la ciudad en donde vive hoy en día.

En el trabajo diario del taller se involucra activamente su hijo, en sus tiempos libres, generalmente por la mañana ya que en la tarde asiste a la escuela. El taller se encuentra ubicado a 4 kilómetros de la vivienda y se transporta en su vehículo a diario, el tiempo de trabajo es variable en ocasiones cuando hay mayor demanda de trabajo realizan jornadas nocturnas;  pero generalmente el trabajo se realiza de  7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para la construcción de una galera  adicional en su taller, ya que el espacio no es adecuado para realizar su trabajo, esto le está generando pérdida de clientes  y dinero; con la construcción de esta estructura se podrán ubicar 10 vehículos con espacio para trabajar fácilmente, dando la oportunidad de empleo a otras 2 personas para solventar la demanda.
  
En el futuro, espera aperturar una sucursal de su taller en otra ciudad,  para tener mayor cobertura de  la zona, conformando  una pequeña empresa. Además, espera que su hijo tenga la oportunidad de realizar estudios profesionales relacionados a lo que se dedican para ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
Don Willian is 42, and thanks to his parents' sacrifices, was able to go to school and earn a high school diploma. Upon graduating, Willian began studying auto repair, specializing in body work and painting. At that time, he also met his future wife, and the mother of their 13-year-old son. The boy is now in the eighth grade at a middle school. Don Willian's wife manages a food stall at the local market, providing income that helps meet the family's expenses. 

Don Willian owns an auto body and paint shop in the city of Sensuntepeque. He began learning auto body repair and painting 25 years ago in the capital, San Salvador, and over the years set himself up in Sensuntepeque, where he and his family now live.   

Don Willian's son takes an active, daily role in the shop during his free time, generally in the morning before he goes to school in the afternoon. The shop is located four kilometers from the family's home and Don Willian drives his own car to work each morning. His schedule varies with the volume of business, and he sometimes has to work nights, but he is generally at the shop from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. 

Don Willian wlll use the loan funds to build a new workspace at the shop, as the shop isn't big enough to handle all of the work. The lack of space is costing Don Willian customers and money. The new workspace will accommodate 10 cars and allow Don Willian to work comfortably. He'll also be able hire two other employees to meet demand.   
  
Don Willian hopes to open a new shop in another city in the future, so he can serve a larger area and establish a small business. He also hopes his son will be able to study both auto body repair and business so that father and son can offer superior service to their customers.

loans.use: to construct a new workspace for his shop, which isn't big enough to handle all of the work.

loans.name: Noura Group

texts.en:
This group is called Noura and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER (Yemen Rial) from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. 

Asria, one of the members, is 35 years old and responsible for six children. She strives to help her family by offering them a good life. She complains of a lack of money to complete her house. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 YER to buy construction supplies for her house. 

She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: José Martín

texts.es:
Don José de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, esta acompañado, su  pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a la venta de ropa, procrearon 4 hijos, su hijo mayor también le ayuda en el negocio,mientras los otros tres se encuentran  estudiando.

Él posee un negocio de venta de hamacas, cubrecamas y mosquiteros, desde aproximadamente 8 años desempeña esta actividad. Con la diferencia que anteriormente lo hacia como empleado y hoy es propio; oficios que aprendió de su patrón con quien trabajo 4 años, anterior se dedicaba a albañil. El viaja en motocicleta a las diferentes comunidades, de los municipios cercanos donde tiene unos 60 clientes a los que les da productos al crédito, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. tambien su hijo visita otras zonas .


El préstamo qu esta solicitando, es para surtir su negocio comprara mas hamacas y mas mosquiteros que es lo que mas vende y ampliara el área de cobertura; para que sus ingresos mejoren y pueda cancelar su crédito y con las ganancias seguir construyendo su nueva vivienda.

El sueño que tiene Don José, es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, también con las ganancias obtenidas de la producción, tiene pensado mejorar su pequeño negocio. Para todo esto, sabe que podrá lograrlo, solamente si continua trabajando fuertemente, como hasta hoy lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old, studied up until the 9th grade, and is in a relationship.  His partner takes care of the household chores and sells clothing for a living.  They have four children; their oldest son also helps with the business while the other three are in school.  

He has a business selling hammocks, bedspreads, and mosquito nets.  He has had this business for about eight years.  The difference is that he used to do this work as an employee and now he has his own business.  He learned these skills from his boss, whom he worked with for four years.  Before that he worked as a carpenter.  He travels by motorcycle to different communities in the neighboring municipalities where he has 60 customers he sells to on credit.  His work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.  His son also travels to other areas.  

The loan he is asking for is to stock his business.  He will buy more hammocks and more mosquito nets, which are what he sells the most of, and he will extend his selling range so his profits improve and he can repay his debt and use his earnings to continue construction on his new home.  

José's drean is to improve the infrastructure of his home and he is also thinking about using the earnings from his production to improve his small business.  He knows that he can only achieve all of this if he keeps working hard, as he has all along.

loans.use: to stock his business, he will buy more hammocks and more mosquito nets, which are what he sells the most of, and he will extend his selling range

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмире 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Элмиры - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Элмира занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Элмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 5 лошадей, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,55 ГА, на которой ежегодно выращивает люцерну и ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Elmira is 50 years old, married, and is currently raising 3 children together with her husband.  She has a university education, and most of her family’s income comes from raising livestock and growing crops, having started nearly 15 years ago with 10,000 KGS’ worth of cattle.  Thanks to her determined efforts, her farm now has 5 dairy cows and 5 horses, as well as 2.55 hectares’ worth of land for growing alfalfa and barley each year, and her monthly income has risen to 10,000 KGS.   

To develop her farm further, Elmira is requesting a loan of 100,000 KGS from the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners; she hopes to use the money to buy more cows and increase her herds.  She plans on using the additional income that the loan will allow her to continue to buy more cows, as well as to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: В городе Исфара очень мало развлекательных центров, точнее, их почти нет. В Исфаре живет Азимчон. Ему 34 года, он женат и имеет троих детей. У Азимчона в городском парке есть развлекательный - игровой центр. Игровые автоматы предназначены для детей и подростков такие как «тир, кран, теннис и хоккей». Азимчон уже 15 лет занимается этим делом и ему помогает его жена. Сейчас он просит кредит на ремонт игровых автоматов для продвижения деятельности. К сожалению это пока единственный развлекательный центр в городе Исфары.
texts.en: In the city of Isfara, there are not too many recreational venues; to be more precise, there are almost none at all.  Isfara is where Azimjon lives.  He is 34, married with 3 kids, and owns a gaming center in the city park with several arcade machines for children and teens; these include a shooting-gallery game, a claw machine, tennis, and hockey.  Together, Azimjon and his wife have been operating the center for the past 15 years, which, sadly enough, is the only one of its kind in Isfara.  He is requesting a loan to repair and maintain his arcade machines so he can continue operating his business.

loans.use: to repair and maintain arcade machines so he can continue operating his business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with six children. She has received some schooling until the end of middle school. 

Currently, Jane sells plantain and cassava in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about 15 years now. Her husband is a farmer. Jane’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Jane will use the loan to increase her existing inventory capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Jane plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing inventory capacity.

loans.name: Work Fine Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Work Fine” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each member in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Mabinty is the featured leader of this group. Mabinty is 44 years old and she is married with 6 children – 3 in primary school and 3 in secondary school. Mabinty sells dried fish and has been a businesswoman for 25 years now. With the help of this loan, Mabinty will invest in her business by buying a large quantity of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба  в ИМОНе кредитуется третий  раз. Она добросовестная, честная,  целеустремленная  и  трудолюбивая  женщина. Она родилась  сельской  местности. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей.  Она  работает  в  школе  преподавателем.  Муж  работает  строителем, и в  летний  сезон, он  каждый  год  ездит  в   Россию,  чтобы  зарабатывать  деньги. Матлюба и ее муж несколько лет назад начали стройку дома для своей семьи, так как данное время они живут у родителей. До сих пор они не закончили стройку дома, и поэтому она обратилась за займом, чтобы купить шифер, древесину и т.п. Она  ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
This will be Matluba's third loan with IMON International. She is a conscientious, honest, goal-oriented, and hardworking woman. She was born in a rural area, is married, and is raising two young children. She teaches at a school. Her husband works in construction and travels to Russia every summer to earn a living. 

A few years ago, Matluba and her husband started building a house for their family, since they are currently living with their parents. As they have not yet finished building their house, Matluba is requesting a loan in order to buy slate, wood, and other materials. She appreciates your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: To buy slate, wood, and other materials for building a house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is single with four children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market seven days out of every week. She has been in this business for 13 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.  She generates additional income through selling tomatoes and sweet potatoes. She sells on both a retail and a wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and   defaulters. 

Ruth is aspiring of going to villages in the Masaka district for green bananas and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Fortuna

texts.es: Fortuna tiene 62 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad de Patria junto con su pareja y tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la agricultura entonces cosecha hojas de coca y yuca. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para semillas y abono y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Patria es una ciudad de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
Fortuna is 62 years old and lives in the stunning city of Patria with her partner and four children. She is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking person who is always striving to get ahead. Fortuna has for several years worked as a farmer growing coca and yucca, and approaches the daily demands of farm labor with great dedication. Thanks  to her hard work and effort, business has been very good. 

Fortuna belongs to the “Señor de Huanca” [Lord of Huanca] Communal Bank and is applying for a loan to purchase seeds and manure. These supplies will represent an increase her working capital. Fortuna is grateful for the loan, recognizes its value, and is committed to making timely and full payments. (People in Patria have a great reputation for selling products that they harvest from the jungle, as well as for tourism and restaurants. Patria is a gateway to Manu National Park).

loans.use: to purchase seeds and manure.

loans.name: Lisber Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Lisber, Madre soltera, trabajadora y responsable, desde hace 4 años que tiene su propio negocio de venta de Frutas y Verduras, sus hijos le ayudan con el negocio ya que muchas veces las ventas son muy prosperas y requiere de apoyo, doña Lisber actualmente necesita invertir un poco mas en su negocio, ya que gracias a Dios sus clientes cada dia le piden mas productos y ella quiere a problechar esta temporada alta para obtener mejores ingresos ya que solo ella es la encargada de los gastos del hogar. muy agradecido se muestra doña Lisber con Afodenic y Fondos Kiva por la confianza brindada con este credito.
texts.en:
Lisber is a single mother who works and is responsible.  For four years she has had her own business selling fruits and vegetables.  Her children help with her business since sales are often very prosperous and require more assistance. 

She actually needs to invest more in her business because, thanks to God, her customers ask for more products every day.  She wants to take advantage of the high season to obtain better income, because she is responsible for the household expenses.  

She is very grateful for Afodenic and Kiva funds for trusting her with this credit.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Abizerwa B Cb Group

texts.en:
Theodosie (pictured with her hand raised) is a group leader of a group called Abizerwa, which means “Trustworthy” in English. She is a 49-year-old married with four children. Her children are between the ages of 17 and 26, and they all go to school.

As a group leader on behalf of other members, she said that “Each group member sells different goods, with the aim of transforming their businesses to higher levels.” Since 2001 she has been active selling foodstuffs.

She has requested this loan to increase the inventory of her foodstuffs. In the future, she would like to become a wholesaler. She plans on saving the profits she expects to generate from her business as a result of the loan so that she can continue to improve her business and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (of foodstuffs) for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a mother of two children. She lives in her own house, which has no electricity.

For the past three years, she has been operating a retail shop business. Specifically, she sells household food items, such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

With the requested loan, she would like to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour for re-sale. She decided to join Yehu so that she can more easily access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour) for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Grupo La Union Group

texts.es: Grupo La Unión está conformado por cinco mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables viven en una comunidad muy bonita pero retirada de la carretera central para llegar a ella se tiene que caminar varios minutos. Todas las integrantes del grupo  son emprendedores y se trata de un nuevo equipo que se está integrando para trabajar con Vision Fund .  El nombre se eligió ya que las personas tienen como objetivo permanecer unidos, sobre todo en periodos difíciles. Los integrantes del grupo son Martha Alicia, Wendy, Abigail y Briana se dedican a la crianza de animales como pollos, guajolotes, borregos, becerros Teresa invertirá su crédito en bordados. Doña Martha de 52 años de edad, está casada desde hace 28 años con el señor Adán quien se dedica al campo; juntos han formado una familia con 3 niños de los cuales uno asisten a la escuela. Doña Martha se dedica a la crianza de borregos desde hace 6 años. Esta actividad la aprendió de su esposo ya que él siempre se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales. Ella espera poder comprar cinco borregos con su préstamo y desea tener un negocio exitoso ya que no quiere seguir trabajando en la Ciudad de México, actividad que ha estado realizando para ayudarle a su esposo para solventar los gastos del hogar. Doña Martha comenta: "Me gustaría pasar más tiempo con mi familia, atender a mis hijos y ya no trabajar tan lejos. Sin embargo, la dificultad que presento es la falta de alimento para mis criar mis borregos porque es muy caro comprarlos y además porque debo comprarle alimentos, porque si no lo compro, los borregos empiezan a enflacar y así no me los quiere pagar a buen precio". Es por eso que el crédito será de gran ayuda para comprar los animales y el alimento adecuado para mantenerlos en buenas condiciones. En el general, todo el grupo está agradecido con KIVA y Vision Fund y contento por los créditos otorgados a cada una de las integrantes ayudara para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en: Grupo La Unión is made up of five very hardworking and responsible women. They live in a community that is very pretty, but that is set back from the main road and can only be reached by several minutes of walking. All of the group's members are enterprising and and they are a new team that is joining up to work with Vision Fund.  They chose their name because their goal is to remain united, especially during hard times.  The group's members are Martha Alicia, Wendy, Abigail, and Briana, and they raise animals such as chickens, turkeys, sheep, and calves.  Teresa will invest her loan in embroidery.  Martha is 52 years old and for 28 years she has been married to Adán, who works in the field for a living.  Together they have a family with three children, one of whom is in school.  Martha has been raising calves for six years.  She learned this business from her husband, as he has always worked in livestock.  She hopes to buy five calves with her loan and she wants to have a successful business, as she does not want to work in Mexico City anymore, which she has been doing to help her husband with the household expenses.  Martha tells us, "I would like to spend more time with my family, care for my children, and not work so far away anymore.  However, the problem we had was a lack of feed for my calves because it is very expensive to buy them and on top of that I have to buy them food because if I don't, the calves get skinny and I can't get a good price for them."  This is why the loan will be a great help; to buy the animals and the food they need to keep them in good shape.  As a whole, the group is thankful to Kiva and Vision Fund and they are happy with the loans each of the members have received to help improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy calves and feed

location.town: Rioyos Buenavista, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru: Чынар 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Чынар - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе, имеет большой авторитет среди сельчан. Чынар в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с покупки скота на 35,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чынар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 телка, 12 овец, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чынар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Chynar is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She is educated and teaches at a school, and is highly respected in her community. 

As an additional source of income for her family, Chynar also raises livestock. She started 7 years ago by purchasing livestock for 35,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Chynar now has one dairy cow, one heifer, 12 sheep, and one horse. Her income is 20,000 KGS. In order to grow her business, Chynar is requesting a loan from Bai Tushum & Partners in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy sheep and add to her livestock. Chynar plans to reinvest her earnings from this microloan in her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Zoje

texts.en:
Zoje wants to build a stable with the amount of 150,000 Lek and she is seeking financial help from Kiva lenders. It is very cold in this region of Albania in the winter, and her animals need to stay warm during the long and snowy winters. She has been in livestock activities for almost 20 years and has been selling raw milk to nearby dairy farms and to the locals as well.

She is a widowed mother of four children. “I have raised the kids almost all on my own. Yet, when they started growing, they helped me so much with the chores and with the outside work, the animals and the planting, etc. One of my children was born with a disability, so I have to look after this child as well, but anyhow, with God’s help everything can be achieved,” Zoje said, sighing.

loans.use: To build a stable.

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
The two cows that Zef had were stolen from the stable five months ago.   He never found out who did that, yet this caused him a major setback. 

“Both cows were from a very good breed.  Each one of them was producing roughly 40 kg.  Selling their milk was my family’s income. My wife and I became very upset for long time after, not only because we were cut off financially but because we loved them too. When you care for animals, you happen to love them, and we did. Now I want to buy a cow and a baby calf with this loan,” Zef said, looking away. 

Zef is married and has one child, who still goes to school.  He has been in the livestock type of activity for some 18 years, selling raw milk to neighboring dairy farms.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and a calf

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Нуриддину 27 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 не совершеннолетних детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Нуриддин является единственным кормильцем в семье. Нуриддин вместе с семьёй живет в сельской местности и поэтому единственным источником его дохода является земледелие. Он в основном выращивает зерно. Нуриддин получает маленький доход и поэтому живет бедно. Он должен купить продукты питания и другие средства для проживания, но данное время он не имеет денег. Его мать и младший брат живут вместе с ним. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nuriddin is 27 years old. He is married and has 2 children in his care. His wife is a housewife. Nuriddin is the only breadwinner in the family. Nuriddin and his family live in a rural area and, for that reason, his only source of income is agriculture. For the most part, he grows grain. Nuriddin receives a small income and, as such, lives a poor life. He has to buy food and other living essentials but he currently has no money. His mother and younger brother live with him. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy food and household products for his family

loans.name: Kalbu

texts.ru: Калбу 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 7 детей. У Калбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Калбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Калбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойных коровы и 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на использование кредита на сбор урожая. Доходы от кредита Калбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Kalbu is 57 years old, married and she and her husband are raising 7 children. Kalbu has high school education and, as the main source of income for her family, Kalbu rears animals, which she started doing 20 years ago when she purchased livestock for 5,000 Kyrgyzstani som. Thanks to Kalbu's unyielding hard work, she now has 4 dairy cows and 10 sheep. Her monthly income is 10,000 som. 

With the aim of further developing her farm, Kalbu approached the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som, which she would use to pay the costs of harvesting. Kalbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in increasing the quantity of her livestock.

loans.use: to carry out the harvest

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 27-year-old married man.

For 13 years, he has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables. In 2007, he started working on his own. At that time, he established his small business and has been using a small carriage to travel to neighboring villages to sell his goods. He took this step forward to generate additional income and to improve his family's living conditions.

Husein is seeking a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to expand his business by purchasing special seasonal fruits and vegetables. His customers request such fruits and vegetables, and at the same time he feels the additional fruits and vegetables will enable him to attract new customers. As a result, he expects to generate additional income with the help of the loan. In the future, he hopes to open his own shop and to start a wholesale trading business.

loans.use: To meet customer demand and to attract new customers by purchasing seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 23-year-old single man who has been working in manufacturing and selling furniture for eight years. In 2007, he started his own business, which was a very impressive step forward. It reflected positively on his socio-economic situation because he is highly talented in this domain.

He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary wood, sponge and textiles to expand his work by manufacturing and selling new furniture designs. This loan will help him a lot in increasing his production, which will attract new customers and increase his sales.

He hopes to open a furniture gallery in the future where he can display all of his designs and creations in an artistic way.

loans.use: To buy necessary wood, sponge and textiles to expand his work by manufacturing and selling new furniture designs.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is an Egyptian Albanian, who has been collecting metal scrap for cash for almost eleven years. She sells the scrap to some metallurgic complexes near her district. 

A loan of 80,000 Albanian Lek that she is requesting will give her the opportunity to pay for more scrap to sell.

Lindita is a married mother of three, school-aged children. Her children are attending school, even though a majority of the kids in their ethnic minority group do not go to school. Lindita is proud of them. “My husband and I never got any education, and we know what that means, but we both made sure that our children would finish at least the high school, and so they are,” said Lindita.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal

loans.name: Familia Hesiquio Group

texts.es: Familia Hesiquio es un grupo familia fue que por eso decidieron ponerle ese nombre porque es el apellido de la familia el grupo lo integran tres integrantes ellos viven en una comunidad mazahua la caracteriza por tener una vista muy bonita de arboles para llegar al lugar donde se reúnen solo caminando. La fiesta más celebrada es la del 25 de Julio celebran a Santa Ana. Don Gilberto quien es el representante del grupo platica que de cariño le dicen Beto tiene 57 años de edad anteriormente era maestro pero ahora ya esta jubilado esta casado con la señora Aurelia desde hace 33 años juntos han formado una familia con hijos de los cuales aun uno de sus hijos es un dependiente se encuentra estudiando. Don Beto esta solicitando un crédito a KIVA y Vision Fund para comprar productos de abarrotes  para abastecer su tienda cuenta que la inicio porque hace 15 años había una carretera el cual era la única para poder llegar al otro lado de la comunidad como pasaba mucha gente decidió poner su tiendita “Inicie solo poniendo una tablas y unas cajas para mostrar mis abarrotes sin embargo con el tiempo vi la necesidad de comprar anaqueles y refrigeradores nuevos para poder vender carnes frías pero también algunos refrescos fríos” Después de un buen tiempo cerraron la calle y construyeron una barda lo cual provoco las bajas ventas de la tienda de Don Beto fue como decidió comprar otra casa en otro lado pero en la misma comunidad es donde se encuentra ahora su tienda de abarrotes. La dificulta de Don Beto es la competencia pero esta situación no lo desalienta todo lo contrario por eso está solicitando su credito para comprar mas mercancía cree que si tiene de todo en su negocio la clientela aumentara. Porque el sueño de Don Beto es llegar a tener su tienda bien surtida “No me gusta que los clientes se regresen sin nada en las manos  y lleguen a comprarle a otro establecimiento” Doña Aurelia invertirá su crédito en ropa y su hija Aurelia invertirá en su zapatería.
texts.en:
Familia Hesiquio is a family and they chose this name because it’s the family’s last name.  The group is made up of three members who live in a Mazahua community, known for having a very beautiful surrounding of trees.  They meet in a place that can only be reached on foot.  The most celebrated festival is on June 25 where they celebrate Santa Ana.  Gilberto, who represents the group, tells us that his nickname is Beto.  He is 57 years old and was a teacher, but now he is retired and has been married to Aurelia for 33 years.  They formed a family with their children, of whom only one still lives with them.  He is their dependent and attends school.

Beto is asking for a Kiva loan through Vision Fund in order to buy grocery goods to stock his store.  He says that he started it 15 years ago because there was only one road to get to the other side of town and there were many people on it, so he decided to set up his store.  “I started by setting up a table an some boxes to show my products, however over time I saw a need to buy new shelves and refrigerators to be able to sell cold cuts and also some cold soft drinks.”

After some time they closed the road and built a fence, which caused his sales to drop in Beto’s store.  This is when he decided to buy another house in another part of the community, where his store is now located.  Beto’s challenge is the competition, but this situation does not discourage him.  It’s quite the opposite, so he is asking for a loan so he can buy more merchandise.  He feels that if he has a bit of everything in his store, he will attract more customers.  Beto’s dream is to have a well-stocked store.  “I don’t like it when the customers leave with nothing in their hands and then shop at another establishment.”  Aurelia will buy clothing and his daughter will invest in her shoe store.

loans.use: to stock their businesses.

location.town: Santa Ana Nichi, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro vive en la hermosa ciudad de Patria junto con su familia, él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la agricultura pues cosecha de hoja de coca, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Alejandro lives in a beautiful city of Patria together with his family.  He is an enterprising and hard working person who puts effort and dedication toward his work.  His principal economic activity is cultivating the coca leaf.  

He is part of a communal bank called "Señor de Huanca de Patria".  This opportunity requires that the loan be used for buying seeds and manure to increase his working capital in this area.  

He is thankful and appreciates the loan and he is committed to paying the monthly installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Chelule

texts.en:
Chelule is a 33-year-old, married man. He is married to Norah. They have children between the ages of six and twelve years old.

To earn a living, he buys sand from a mining firm and sells it to construction workers. He explains that he has been in this line of business for the last ten years, and that his business operations typically earn him a monthly income of approximately 26,000 KES.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES, which he would use to acquire a donkey cart to more easily transport the sand. He plans on saving any additional income he generates as a result of the loan. Chelule's dream is to expand his business into a highly profitable venture and to thereby improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to more easily transport sand

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is from Kapan town where he lives with his wife and two little children. Upon returning from the army, Davit started three years ago to provide renovation services. Due to his hard work, Davit was able to sustain his family with the income that he gathered from providing this service. 

Now, for purchasing working tools and working more effectively, Davit needs financial support. He has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because his business isn't registered as a formal business. 

Davit has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The Start-up Loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

This loan is necessary for Davit to purchase a compressor and a power saw and continue his business.

loans.use: to pay for a compressor and a power saw for providing renovation services.

loans.name: Rono

texts.en: Rono is 34 years old and married to Betty. They are blessed with three children. Rono has been in this business for the last 8 years with a monthly income of about Ksh 15,000. He qualified with KADET LTD to get his first loan of Ksh 20,000 which he plans to use to purchase more cows. His hope and dream is to become a successful man.

loans.use: To buy more cows.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia  is a single mother of one child and her only child goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her niece). She has a restaurant and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 2,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, charcoal, eggs, cooking oil and chicken.  She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.  

Julia works six days out of every week and sells on retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include ever increasing prices of cooking oil and Irish potatoes, seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked restaurant and also to building her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more  bags of Irish potatoes, charcoal,eggs, cooking oil and chicken.

loans.name: Njoroge

texts.en:
Njoroge is a resident of the Mukuru informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya. He is a husband and a proud father of four children. Njoroge runs a small business as a retailer and is also a landlord, but finds his landlord business to be the most lucrative.

Due to the lack of sanitation facilities in the area where he owns plots, Njoroge is seeking a loan to purchase two Fresh Life toilets for his tenants. He prefers Fresh Life toilets because they are more economical to construct and cleaner than other available options. He hopes that these toilets will enable him to provide better sanitation and improve the quality of life for his tenants. He also anticipates that this move will enable him to earn a little bit more from his investment. 

Njoroge plans to build more toilets in the future and fund his children's education comfortably when his venture succeeds.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets.

loans.name: Janat Group

texts.en:
This group is called Janat and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Azia is living in a poor area in Sana`a. She is a married woman and has children.

She always suffers when the electricity at her house is cut. She accumulated a small amount to buy an electric generator to use for her house. Now she has applied for a loan of 40,000 Yemen Rial (YER) from AMB to buy an electric generator to live more comfortably with her family. She hopes to be funded by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy an an electric generator to live more comfortably with her family.

loans.name: Buruno

texts.en:
Buruno is a married man, aged 42 years. He has four children, and the famly lives in a rural setting. Two of his children are attending primary school in his village. Two of his children are ten and eight, and his twins are a year.

Buruno is a fish monger.  He works seven days a week, and each day he works for eight hours. He supplements his family income with agriculture and he grows matoke in particular.

Buruno has been in the fish trading business for 21 years.  He specialized in fish mongering due to the availability of markets to sell fish and the geographical location of his area.  He can access Lake Kijjabaloora easily, which supplies the fish he sells.

This is his third cycle loan.  So far he has received loan facilities of UGX 200,000 and UGX 500,000, and now he has acquired UGX 1,300,000. He acquired this loan facility to buy a motorcycle for transporting his products, since transport has been his biggest problem.

He sells his products to residents around Rakai district, since he sells in all the markets around the district. He hopes to expand his business to the level of supplying fish in the neighboring country of Tanzania.

Buruno faces the challenge of high taxes charged at the fishing sites and the lack of a refrigerator for preserving his goods, since they spoil quickly.

He describes himself as a hard-working and honest man, and he urges lenders to continue the work they are doing, since they have touched the lives of the poor people.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transporting his fish

loans.name: Gjyste

texts.en:
Gjyste, a mother of two and whose husband is disabled, owns a little store near a school in the rural northern Albanian village where they reside. She also has been running a livestock business for almost 22 years, selling milk and other dairy products at her store. Gjyste also makes cheese pies for the schoolchildren with the milk from her own cows.
