Gjyste's business has been growing and this makes her happy. She is now applying for her first loan which will be used to purchase  another dairy cow.  She considers herself lucky that the location of her store attracts patronage from the schoolchildren and their parents.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es: Marta, a sus 45 años de edad es madre cabeza de hogar, pues tiene dos hijos de los cuales se hace cargo desde que su esposo falleció. Hace aproximadamente 20 años se dedica a la confección, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus conocimientos y su técnica; actualmente presta sus servicios a terceros, pues tiene contratos con algunos vecinos del sector, trabaja de lunes a sábado de 8:00 am a 6:00 pm o de acuerdo a la rotación de trabajo que tenga. Es así como ha logrado generar los recursos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y brindar educación a sus hijos. La cliente es una señora emprendedora, activa, dedicada a su familia y a su labor, esto la motiva a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una máquina fileteadora con la que podrá mejorar su capacidad instalada, agilizar el trabajo y mejorar los tiempos de producción para entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna con prendas terminadas de mejor calidad, esto se verá reflejado en el aumento de los contratos y por ende en la entrada de ingresos para seguir velando por el bienestar de su familia. Es así como Marta desea seguir avanzando y cumplir el sueño de fortalecer su negocio, haciéndolo más rentable para que le permita dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mejor educación, especialmente a su hija mejor.
texts.en: At 45 years old, Marta is the head of her household, as she has two children who have been dependent on her since her husband passed away.  She started out sewing around 20 years ago.  She learned the business empirically and little by little she has perfected her knowledge and technique.  She currently works with third parties as she has contracts with some neighbors in the area.  She works Monday through Saturday from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. or according to the amount of work she has.  This is how she has been able to generate the income to provide the daily necessities to her household and to provide her children with an education.  She is an enterprising, active woman who is dedicated to her family and her work, which motivated her to ask for a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine.  It will increase her current capacity, facilitate her work, and improve her production time in filling orders with the best quality finished garments.  This will be reflected in an increase in contracts and an accompanying increase in income that will allow her to keep ensuring her family's wellbeing.  In this way, Marta wants to keep moving forward to achieve her dream of strengthening her business and making it more profitable so she can offer her children, and especially her older daughter, a better quality of life and a better education.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Girimpuhwe Cb Group

texts.en:
Girimpuhwe Cb is a group led by Marie Rose, who is 30 years old. The group name means “Have Pity.” The group members live in different locations, selling different items.

Marie Rose sells various merchandise in her store, such as salt, sugar, flour, cooking oil, and many more. She is married to a welder, and they have together four children. All of their children attend school. With the profits from the business, Marie Rose will renovate the house, as she strives to make more savings. In the photo, Marie Rose puts up her hand, for clear differentiation from other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy more salt, flour, cooking oil, and other inventory items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy packages of cologne

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 50 years old and lives at New Kru Town in Montserrado County. She is married and has four children between the ages of 20 and 30. For the past ten years she has been running a table in the local market where she sells fish. She makes a lot of profit because she sells quality fish. Some of the problems she is facing are that she has low income and transportation costs are very high. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 61 years old. She lives in the Gurjaani district in the Kakheti Region with her husband, Soso, and her mother. Her mother is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of land where peach trees are grown. They produce wine and sell it locally along with the harvested peaches. 

As the income is seasonal and not enough for the family, Ketevan decided to start her own family business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. 

The Startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 5,000 Gel. 

With the received credit, Ketevan will open a metal and plastic workshop. Soso will work in the workshop and get orders to produce metal and plastic products, as he is experienced in this field. Ketevan hopes that the business will be profitable and they will be able to expand it in the future to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a metal and plastic workshop.

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Lucia  tiene  42 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella y convive con su esposo,  se dedica a la venta de abarrotería desde hace mas de 20 años actividad que le da los ingresos con la que ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia dándoles educación y apoyando a su esposo con los gastos en el hogar.
Doña Lucia esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, arroz, azúcar, carnes de pollo, res, pastas de tomate, embutidos, lácteos, etc. y  así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ya que se aproxima la temporada altas en ventas en la zona y piensa surtir mas su negocio.
Doña Lucia con el préstamo que reciba le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio y espera que le ayude a mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Lucia su sueño es darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia y estudio a sus hijos.


Danli, Honduras -Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Lucia is 42 years old, lives with her husband and has two children who depend on her. She has run a grocery store for more than 20 years. Which brings in the money to get her family ahead, providing the children their education and helping her husband with the household expenses. 

Lucia is requesting this loan to buy corn, wood, rice, sugar, chicken, beef, tomato paste, sausages, dairy products etc. so she can fulfill the demand from customers. The high season is coming for sales in her region and she is thinking of stocking her store. With the help of the loan she can have a better supply in her store and she hopes that will increase her income so she can cover the family expenses and other financial obligations. Lucia's dream is to give her family a better standard of living and better education.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, rice, sugar, chicken, beef, tomato paste, sausages, dairy products etc. for her business.

loans.name: Inkoramutima Cb Group

texts.en:
Esperance is 48 years old. She is married, with eight children, ages between 7 and 25. They all go to school. 

Esperance leads a group called "Inkoramutima," loosely translated in English as “close friends.”  They sell different items, and she has spent 18 years in her business. With the loan, Esperance would like to buy more beer and soda for resale at her pub. 

With the profits from the business, she plans to save more.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda for sale.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda is 46 years old and live in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia and well-known for that.  Finda is married and has three children, ages 8, 11, and 15, all in school and living at home. 

Over the past seven years, Finda has had a table where she sells fish. She started this business with a little money that she received from her husband, and she learned this way of selling from her friends.

She is very happy with her business because she makes lots of profits, and it keeps her busy.  Most interestingly she has learned different kinds of local languages. 

Finda is requesting a loan to buy more fish to expand her business. Her plans are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia tiene 57 años de edad tiene 1 hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo, su esposo es trabaja en una empresa de transporte de personas, la actividad que se dedica Doña Lucia es la venta de abarrotería desde hace mas de 26 años.
Doña Lucia esta actividad le ayuda a generarse los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a su familia dándoles educación y apoyando a su esposo con los gastos en el hogar, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, arroz, azúcar, carnes de pollo, res, pastas de tomate, embutidos, lácteos , etc. y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, con el apoyo del préstamo espera que le contribuya a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio.
Doña Lucia espera cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros, su sueños es darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia y estudio a sus hijos y tener una vejez tranquila,  gracias al apoyo que reciba de Prisma de Honduras le contribuirá a cumplir con los sueños.
 

Danli, Honduras - Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Lucia is 57 years old lives with her husband and has one child who is dependent on her. Her husband works for a transportation company. Lucia has had her grocery store for more than 26 years. His activity allows her to generate the income to get her family ahead, educate her child and help her husband with the household expenses. 

Lucia is requesting this loan to buy corn, wood, rice, sugar, chicken, beef, tomato paste, sausages, dairy products etc. She wants to satisfy the customer's demands and with the help of the loan hopes to better stock her store. Lucia hopes to cover the family expenses and other financial obligations. Her goal is to give her family a higher standard of living and better education and enjoy a quiet golden age. The help she gets from Prisma Honduras can help her achieve her dreams.
Danli, Honduras - August 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, rice, sugar, chicken, beef, tomato paste, sausages, dairy products etc. for her business.

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny is a young man, aged 23 years.  He lives in a rural setting, and he is a businessman who deals in bark-cloth trading. Bark cloth comes from a local tree and was used as clothes in the old days.

Tonny works seven days a week, and each day he works for twelve hours. He supplements his income with agriculture, where he grows coffee.
Tonny has been in this business since 1996 and he supplements his income with agriculture that he carries out in season.

He learned this business from experience he acquired from his family members.  Being an early school dropout, he was engaged in this activity at a tender age.

He is acquiring this loan to add in his business by purchasing more stocks of bark clothes. He sells his products to traders in the city who mainly make crafts.

He hopes to expand his business to the level of exporting to other countries. However, he faces the challenge of high transport costs.  He describes himself as hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To buy bark cloth for trading

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is a married, 24 years of age, and has two children, ages 2 and 5 years.  Bendu was able to complete the 12th grade before engaging herself in business.

She is good at managing her business, which she has been involved with for five years now, selling tomatoes, peppers, red oil, etc., in the local market. With the loan proceeds, she will buy more goods of that sort to increase her sales. She said that besides too few goods on her market table, she has no other problems for now. 

She received a little money from her husband to establish this business, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She enjoys the flow of her customers, and her plan is to increase her business even more.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, red oil, etc., for her market table

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica lives in New-Kru-Town.  She is 29 years old and unmarried, with a six-months-old child.  Scholastica finished the 12th grade, and she decided to do business in order to make some money to maintain her home. 

She has been selling cosmetics, such as medicated soap, body-spray, after-bath (body lotion), perfume, etc., to improve her life. She started this business with a little money from her mother two years ago. She said that too few goods on her table are the only challenge she faces now. 

She likes her business because is affordable, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She said I am proud of my business because it is the only means I can to help my child.  With the loan she is going to buy more cosmetics to resell.

Her plan is to increase her sales even more by building a store and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar en la actividad de la siembra de maíz; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, abono, entre otros.
El crédito anterior comenta el Sr. Salvador  que le permitió aumentar la producción y sus ingresos, estos los invierte en los gastos básicos del hogar. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Salvador is requesting a new loan because he needs more capital in order to continue his business of planting corn.  This investment will help him to buy necessary farming supplies such as pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, compost, and other items.  

Sr. Salvador said that his previous loan allowed him to increase his production and his earnings.  The profits were invested in basic household expenses.  His financial condition and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, compost, and other supplies.

loans.name: Asya

texts.ru: Асе 57 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 4 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Аси - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Ася занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Аси, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ася обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Ася планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Asya is 57 and a widow, raising four children and taking care of her farm by herself after the death of her husband. Asya has a specialist high school education and raises animals and crops as her family's primary source of income, a business she began 14 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 15,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Asya's farm now contains two milking cows, two calves and five sheep, with monthly income at 10,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her farm, Asya has turned to microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase steers for fattening and then reselling at the market for a higher price. Asya plans to use income from the loan for further augmentation of the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia, 30 years old, lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult, due to the high crime rate, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions, and overpopulation, but the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are options for traveling, the town contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and food is less expensive.    

Cynthia is unmarried and she has two children, ages nine and ten. They are attending school and living at home. Cynthia was able to complete 9th grade before starting her business. 

For the past five years, she has been busy running her shop where she sells drinks, like stout, beer, and soft drinks, among others. 

With the loan proceeds, she will buy more drinks for her business. She said, "Besides fewer goods in stock, I have no other problems, for now." 

With a little money from her mother, she managed to establish this business and she learned by watching other businesswomen. She said, "I enjoy the flow of customers and the fast buying."  

Her dreams are to move from the drink shop business to a restaurant business and to live a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: La familia de Daniel se ha dedicado a la producción de café por varias generaciones, por lo que para él es muy natural dedicarse a esta actividad. Daniel necesita realizar algunas labores en su finca como limpieza y poda. También necesita contratar trabajadores para que en la época de cosecha le ayuden a cortar el café. Para poder realizar estas acciones solicita un crédito que pagará al final de la cosecha. Además de producir café Daniel y su hermano tienen un taller de balconería donde realizan puertas y protecciones para ventanas, entro otras cosas y el cual les sirve para tener un ingreso extra para su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel’s family has been involved in coffee production for several generations, so it is very natural that he would continue in this tradition.  He needs to have a few jobs completed on his farm, such as clearing and pruning.  Daniel also needs to hire workers for the harvest season to help with pruning the coffee plants.  In order to accomplish these tasks, he is requesting a loan that will be repaid at the end of the harvest.  

In addition to producing coffee, Daniel and his brother have a metal shop where they make doors, security bars for windows, and other items.  This allows him to earn extra income for his family.

loans.use: to hire workers to handle the clearing and pruning on his coffee farm.

loans.name: We Go Make Am Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “We Go Make Am” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are small-business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more inventories to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Isha. Isha was born in Kailahun, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a trader too and her children are attending primary schools. Isha has been selling used clothes for 4 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy a bale of used clothes to add to her current stock of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to her current stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Wealaye

texts.en:
Wealaye lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions, and over-population. But the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are options for traveling, the community contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and food prices are lower. 

Wealaye is 44 years old and married, with five children aged between 11 and 26 years old; they are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been operating a table market in the local market, where she sells fish. She started this business with money from her mother and learned this way of selling from her aunty. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to move from a table business to a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie lives in New Kru Town, she is 30 years old, single with an 11-year-old child, who is in school and lives at home. For the past five years she has been operating a small shop where she sells cookies and butter. She says she started this business by selling around in the communities with the little goods she could afford, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She says sometimes sales are slow. She is requesting a loan to purchase more butter and cookies for her business; her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more butter and cookies for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married and her husband is a mechanic. They have two children, ages 15 and 25. Only one of their children is currently attending school and living at home. 

Ruth completed grade 12 before starting a shop business. She has been involved with the sale of soft drinks, stout, beer, etc. for eight years now. 

With the loan proceeds, she will buy more soft drinks, stout, beer, etc., to make enough sales. She said, "Besides fewer goods on my table market, I have no other problem, for now." 

With a little money from her mother, she managed to establish this business. She stated, "I enjoy the flow of customers." Her dreams are to move from the shop business to a store business and to live a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, stout, beer, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Easy Living Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Easy Living” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL (Leones) for each, in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group. She is 44 years old and married with three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. 

Kadiatu sells cooked rice with delicious sauce. With the help of this loan, Kadiatu will invest in her business by buying cooking ingredients like rice, fish, onions, tomatoes, etc. in bulk in order to produce more cooked food for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like rice, fish, onions, tomatoes, etc. in bulk in order to produce more cooked food for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 33 years old and from Liberia. Specifically, she lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult, due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions, and over-population. But the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper and there are options for traveling. Interestingly, the community contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, which leads to lower prices for food. 

Margaret is single, with three children aged between 7 and 18, all of whom are in school and live at home. Over the past eight years, she has been operating a table selling crabs. She started this business with money from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more crabs for her business. Her plan is to move from a table business to a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more crabs for her business.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina lives in New Kru Town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of criminal activity, few bathrooms, filthy conditions, overpopulation; but the interesting part is that rooms are bit cheaper, there is an option of traveling, it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and cheaper rates for food. Martina is 42 years old, married with five children ages between 2 and 15. All her children are in school and live at home. For the past five years she has been operating a small shop where she sells items like candy, biscuits, and peanuts. She started this business by selling around in the communities for her mother, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She says sometimes sales are slow. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items like candy, biscuits, and peanuts for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more candy, biscuits, peanuts, etc. for her business

loans.name: Clean Heart Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in Shenge, in western Sierra Leone, 47 years ago. She is married to a fisherman and the couple have five children, three of whom are attending secondary schools. Isatu sells dried fish.

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and, consequently, improve on their living conditions. 

Isatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy baskets of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
After graduating from junior high school, Ama decided to set up her own plantain, cassava and tomatoes business in Domenase (near Cape Coast). With over 14 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited, due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more plantain, cassava and tomatoes for resale. 

She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a corn mill operator) with the upkeep of their house, whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more plantain, cassava and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is divorced and has two children. After successfully graduating senior high school, Efua is now an established businesswoman. She sells second-hand clothing in Mpeasem (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about six years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of second-hand clothing, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to diversify the types of products that she sells, hence, adapting to changing customers' preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Nely Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Nely tiene  49 años de edad no tiene hijos que dependen de ella vive con su hija, en la zona oriente del país, se dedica a la venta de leche, cuajada  y cuenta con un molino de uso domésticos que brinda el servicio de molino de maíz, arroz, frijoles, etc. 
Doña Nely tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a estas actividades generadoras de ingresos con la que ha permitido salir adelante con los gastos en el hogar, esta solicitando el apoyo para la compra de leche y repuestos para reparación de su molino, lo que le permite brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Doña Nely espera que la inversión que realice le sea de mucha ayuda y así poder cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros, su sueños es mejorar la calidad de vida.
 
 

Danli, Honduras  - Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Nely is 49 years old and no longer has children who depend on her. She lives with her daughter in the eastern part of the country. Nely sells milk and curd, and also has a domestic grinding mill with which she grinds corn, rice, beans, etc.

For more than 5 years, Nely has been dedicated to these income generating activities which have permitted her to cover household expenses. Now, Nely is requesting help with the purchase of milk and replacement parts for repairing her grinding mill. This will make it possible to offer her customers better service. 

Nely hopes this investment will be of much help, enabling her to cover family expenses and other financial commitments. Her dream is to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk and replacement parts for her grinding mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for coffee pickers

loans.name: Agnes Esi

texts.en: After graduating from middle school, Agnes Esi decided to set up her own business selling eggs and nuts in Mpeasem (near Cape Coast). With more than seven years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, her ability to do this is limited due to a lack of funding. That's why she is requesting this loan to buy more eggs and nuts to resell. She aims to use the profits from her business to help her husband maintain their house while ensuring that their child is able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and nuts to resell.

loans.name: Veronica Yaa

texts.en:
Veronica Yaa is a small-scale beans, groundnuts, and onions retailer in Mpeasem (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education since she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a welder. 

Veronica Yaa has been working as a beans, groundnuts, and onions retailer for close to 15 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of beans, groundnuts, and onions, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a vegetable stand, hence, helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of beans, groundnuts, and onions, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Ermelinda Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Ermenlinda del Carmen es una habitante del Municipio de Condega, ubicado a unos 35 km al norte de la Ciudad de esteli, ella es enfermera auxiliar y madre soltera con 2 hijas estudiantas de universidad a quienes ella costea los gastos universitarios con esferzo porpio, ella reside e su propia casa desde hace aproximadamente unos 14 años.

La señora ermelinda del carmen es una enfermera profesional que labora para el ministerio de la salud, ella tiene 23 años continuos de desempeñar esta ardua labor a diario ya que este es su unico ingreso para sustentar sus gastos familiares.
Esta clienta se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitau un financiamiento para la construir en su casa de habitacion un servicio sanitario de los que Ceprodel en conjunto con la alcaldia de Condega lleva a nivel de proyecto y con vision de saniamientos de aguas y mejoramiento de las condiciones salubres de la poblacion de condega. ella se muestra positiva y tiene la esperanza que le sera aprobado este credito y de esta manera ella podra ir mejorando las condiciones de su casa y por ende mejorar las condciones de vida de ella y sus hijas, cuando ya cuente un su bano y servicio sanitario mejorado, ella argumenta que necesita este financiamiento ya que sus ingresos mensaules no son suficiente como para poder asumir porcuenta propia todos los costos de la inversion.
texts.en:
Ermelinda del Carmen lives in the municipality of Condega located about 35 kilometers north of the city of Estelí.  She’s an auxiliary nurse and single mother of two daughters who are university students.  She pays for their schooling costs with her own effort.  She has resided in a house of her own for about 14 years.

Ermelinda del Carmen is a professional nurse employed by the Ministry of Health.  She’s been doing this hard work daily for 23 years non-stop since it’s her only source of income for family support.

She came by the Ceprodel offices to request a loan to build one of the bathrooms at home from the project that Ceprodel in conjunction with the city of Condega is carrying out to provide sanitary water and better health conditions to Condega’s residents.

She’s very positive and hopes that the loan will be approved so that she can be improving her house’s conditions and thus her and her daughters’ living conditions with the acquisition of a bathroom and improved sanitary services.  She states that she needs this loan because her monthly income is insufficient for her to take on the entire cost of this investment on her own.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Dorila

texts.es: Dorila es una mujer emprendedora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija. Su actividad  es el comercio, vende bebidas desde hace 15 años, en el trascurso de los años hubieron algunos percance que supo llevar adelante, hoy en día cuenta con otras actividades como la venta de comida y servicio de trasporte urbano interno en su mototaxi lo que le permite mejorar su calidad de vida y cubrir todas sus necesidades básica. Dorila espera seguir creciendo con su negocio y uno de sus sueños es contar con una flota de mototaxis. Este es primer crédito Kiva, y está muy emocionado y agradecido por el apoyo económico que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El préstamo adquirido de S/. 2500.00 será destinado a la compra de bebidas gasificadas y la compra de una refrigeradora.
texts.en:
Dorila’s an enterprising woman living in her own house with her husband and daughter.  Her activity is commerce.  She’s sold beverages for 15 years.  As time’s gone by she’s had some problems but she’s been able to overcome them.  Today she has other activities too like food sales and internal mototaxi transportation services that make it possible for her to improve her quality of life and cover basic needs.

Dorila hopes to continue growing with her business and one of her dreams is to own a fleet of mototaxis.  This is her first Kiva loan and she’s very excited and grateful for the economic support she gets to continue forward; she also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the obtained 2,500 sol loan to buy carbonated beverages and a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Araba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions, onions, and tomatoes in Mpeasem (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. 

Araba is married and has two children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Araba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence, allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions, onions, and tomatoes. In the long term, Araba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her to expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence, allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions, onions, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Brandon William

texts.es: El Sr. Brandon  tiene 21 años y es soltero, el se dedica al servicio de  todo tipo de transcripciones en su domicilio que se encuentra en la zona de Miraflores, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Brandon  va a usar este préstamo de  para la compra de computadora e impresora y hojas para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital, el va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando material, a El Sr. Brandon  le gusta entregar sus trabajos con puntualidad y esmero ya que dice que los clientes son primero su deseo para su negocio a la larga es poder brindar un servicio de internet, fotocopiadoras y trascripciones.
texts.en: Brandon is 21 years old and is single. He works from home, in the area of Miraflores, providing a variety of transcriptions services. This loan is his first instalment within the institution. Brandon will use this loan to buy a computer, printer and paper for his business. His reason for applying for this loan is to increase his business capital. He is going to use the profits to continue buying materials. Brandon likes to deliver on his work punctually and with dedication, because he maintains that 'customers come first'. His long-term wish for his business is to be able to provide internet service, photocopiers and transcription services.

loans.use: to buy a printer and other computer accessories

loans.name: Sidonie Claudine

texts.fr: Claudine est une jeune femme de 33 ans mariée, mère de 7 enfants et ayant 3 autres à sa charge. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis deux ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de sa famille, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future
texts.en:
Claudine is 33 years old, married, and the mother of seven children.  She also has three additional children in her care.  At the end of her professional training, she opened a beauty salon which she has been running for the past two years.  She is often faced with a shortage of cosmetic products, hair extensions and weaves because she buys her merchandise on a retail basis.

Eager to meet the needs of her customers and to make large profits, she is requesting this loan to buy goods in bulk quantities and therefore to reach her goals.  The profits from this loan will help her to meet her needs as well as those of her family.  She will also be able to save money and increase her activity in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of hair extensions and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and the mother of three children. She has been educated through junior high shcool and earns a living by selling cooked rice in Mpeasem  (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about 13 years, and her husband is a poulltry farmer. Esi’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, she plans to develop her business further by venturing into new markets.

loans.use: to sell more cooked rice.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur who works as a seamstress in Mpeasem (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years, is married and has four children. Her husband is a teacher. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay for their children’s school fees. Efua wants to use her loan to expand her business and sell more items she has sewed. Her goal for the future to reinvest her profits in her business so she can meet growing customer demand.

loans.use: to sell more items she has made on her sewing machine.

loans.name: Clinio

texts.es: Clinio, de 48 años, está casado con Rosana y tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, vive junto a ellos en su casa propia. El trabajo de Clinio consiste en el transporte de pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad a traves de su mototaxi, está siempre presto para movilizar a cualquier cliente que desea llegar sano y salvo a su destino pues una de sus virtudes es ser muy cuidadoso y protector. Lleva realizado este trabajo por más de 15 años. En todo este tiempo a logrado consolidar clientes fijos a quienes traslada de un lugar a otro previa coordinación ya sea a sus trabajos respectivos o la escuela en el caso de menores de edad, en este caso le pagan de manera semanal por el servicio que brinda. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite tener tiempo para estar a lado de su familia en los momentos que se siente agotado, recuerda que empezó con este trabajo muy joven y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia gracias a los días de trabajo que a veces se tornan muy incómodos cuando el sol es muy intenso o cuando las lluvias inundan algunas partes de la ciudad, espera seguir trabajando fiel a su estilo y seguir aportando a su familia la tranquilidad que necesitan. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado comprará llantas que requiere para refaccionar su mototaxi, del mismo modo regularizará sus documentos ya que están a punto de vencer.
texts.en:
Clinio, 48, is married to Rosana and has four adult children.  He lives with them in his own house.  

Clinio’s work consists in passenger transportation inside and outside the city by means of a mototaxi.  He’s always ready to move any customer who wants to arrive safe and sound at their destination because one of his virtues is being a very careful, protective driver.  He’s been doing this work for more than 15 years and in this time has succeeded in securing a regular clientele that he takes from place to place according to previously agreed upon coordination be it to their jobs or to school in the case of minors.  In these cases they pay weekly for the service he provides. 

He likes his work because it allows him to have time to spend with his family.  When he feels exhausted he remembers that he started this work when he was very young and gradually acquired experience thanks to his days of work which sometimes become very uncomfortable when the sun is intense or when the rain floods some parts of the city.  He hopes to continue working in a way that’s faithful to his style and to continue providing his family with the tranquility they require.

On this occasion he’s going to request 800 soles.  He’s grateful to those who make this loan possible so he can continue towards his goals.  He will use the requested amount to buy tires he needs to repair his mototaxi and similarly to regularize his permits that are about to expire.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 48 años de edad, está casada con Niel desde hace 20 años quien es comerciante y padre de sus 3 hijos de 17, 14 y 12 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su casa propia. Nelly se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como delineadores, lapiz labial,  cremas,  perfumes entre otros. Todos estos productos son adquiridos por catálogo y los vende desde su casa entre sus amistades, familiares y vecinos, a quienes atiende de manera amable y cordial, ganándose de esta forma sus preferencias. Tiene más de 5 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Trabaja todos los días generalmente por las tardes mientras que en su casa tiene un pequeño mostrador en el que exhibe todos sus productos para sus clientes. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos y las buenas ganancias que le deja.  En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de  cosméticos tales como labiales, delineadores, perfumes, cremas, entre otros, para tener un stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Nelly, 48, has been married to Niel for 20 years; he’s a merchant and father of their three children who are 17, 14 and 12 years of age respectively.  They all live together comfortably in their own house.  

Nelly works selling cosmetics like eyeliner, lipstick, creams and perfumes, among others.  She gets all these products via catalog and sells them at home to her friends, neighbors and family members who she tends to kindly and cordially thereby winning them over.  She’s been in this business for more than 5 years and to date has done it alone.

She works every day usually in the evenings and also has a small display case at home where she displays her goods for her customers.  She considers the business to be quite profitable because of the high demand her products have and because of the good profits she nets.

On this occasion she will request 2,000 soles.  She’s grateful to those who make this loan that will help her meet her goals possible.  She will use the requested amount to buy cosmetic s like lipstick, eyeliner, perfume and creams, among others to have good stock on-hand to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es: Lili, de 59 años de edad, está casada con Cristóbal con quien tiene 6 hijos, y vive junto a ellos en su casa propia. El trabajo de Lili consiste en la venta de verduras y frutas. Todos los días se traslada por las calles de la ciudad transportando sus productos en una carretilla y llamando con su fuerte voz a sus clientes para que le compren las frutas más deliciosas de la región como mandarinas, manzanas, naranjas, entre otros y las verduras de mayor demanda como papas, tomates, cebollas y limones. Lleva realizando esta actividad cerca de 2 años y lo hace sola. Cuando observa que el sol es demasiado abrasador instala en su casa un modesto puesto y coloca una pequeña mesa bajo la sombra de un plástico para vender ahí durante el día. Es una mujer que ama su trabajo porque es su única fuente de ingresos económicos y eso le permite cubrir los gastos necesarios que le demanda su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 900, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado comprará una gran variedad de verduras como tomates, papas y cebollas y algunas frutas de la región como naranjas y mandarinas para continuar vendiendo por las calles de la ciudad.
texts.en: Lili is 59 years old. She is married to Cristóbal, with whom she has 6 children. She lives with them in her own home. Lili's work consists of selling fruits and vegetables. Every day she goes through the streets of the city in a cart. She calls in her strong voice to her customers so they will buy the most delicious fruit from the area, such as tangerines, apples, oranges, and more. The vegetables that are the most in demand are potatoes, tomatoes, onions and lemons. She has been doing this activity for close to 2 years and she does it alone. When she observes that the sun is too strong, she sets up a small spot in her house and puts up a small table under a plastic shade to sell from there during the day. She is a woman who loves her work because it is her only source of income and it allows her to cover the necessary expense that her family requires. At this time, she will ask for S/. 900. For that, she is grateful to all of the people who make her loan possible so she can cement her plans. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy a wide variety vegetables, such as tomatoes, potatoes and onions and some fruit from the area, such as oranges and tangerines to continue selling in the city streets.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Awulata

texts.en: Awulata earns a living by selling clothing in Mpeasem (near Cape Coast). She has had formal education through the junior high school level, is married and has two children. She uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using this loan to buy more materials to sell, thus meeting rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of doing her selling from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela de 61 años de edad, es una señora luchadora quien no estudio; porque sus padres no la quisieron enviar a estudiar, porque dice que le decían que eso era una perdida de tiempo y solamente se dedicaba a los quehaceres del hogar y haciendo ventas para subsistir. Es por ello que desde pequeña se convirtió en negociante, siempre haciendo enchilados, yuca frita, y cualquier otra cosa que pudiera realizar para la venta 


Si se cuenta desde los 5 años que  menciona, que salía a vender los productos que la mamá elaboraba, ya cuenta con bastantes años de experiencia y sigue luchando para salir adelante, y junto a su esposo, que se dedica a la agricultura y cuando le queda tiempo le ayuda ella a realizar las labores del campo. 

El crédito lo utilizaran para la colocación de una maya alrededor de su vivienda, para así sentirse mas seguros ya que la delincuencia esta afectando la comunidad  y se sentirán mas seguros dentro de su vivienda 


A futura a señora, quiere seguir trabajando ya que dice que el trabajo le gusta y cuando no hace venta se siente mal, y de esta forma quiere seguir trabajando a pesar de su edad, pero es una mujer luchadora que no importando las circunstancias quiere seguir siempre adelante.
texts.en:
Ángela is 61 years old. She is a woman who is a fighter. She didn't go to school because her parents didn't want to send her because they said it was a waste of time and she just did housework and sold things to get by. That is why, since she was young she has been a merchant, always making enchiladas, fried yucca, and anything else that she could make to sell.

Counting the time she would go out with her mother to sell the products she made since she was 5 years old, she has many years' experience and keeps fighting to get ahead with her husband, who works in farming. When she has free time, she helps him to the field work.  

They will use the loan to put a fence around their house in order to feel more secure, since crime is affecting the community and they will feel safer inside their home. 

In the future, she wants to keep on working, since she says she likes the work and when she doesn't do it, she feels bad. In this way, she wants to keep working, despite her age. She is a fighter who always wants to continue ahead, whatever the circumstances.

loans.use: to put in a fence around her house.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 30 años, está casada hace 15 años con Pascual y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Reyna se dedica a brindar servicio de mantenimiento, cambio de repuestos y limpieza de motores a embarcaciones en los ríos. Tiene su negocio instalado en una balsa flotante asentado en el río que se divisa desde la ciudad. Su trabajo le brinda buenos ingresos y se siente muy tranquila ejerciendo ésta función, lo hace con la ayuda de su esposo y gracias a la buena calidad que demuestran sus trabajos han sabido consolidar una buena clientela. Le gusta mucho su trabajo y le agrada ver que sus clientes se quedan muy complacidos y que los pasajeros viajan seguros de llegar a su destino. Trabaja por las mañanas mientras que en las tardes regresa a su hogar a cumplir con las funciones de ama de casa mientras su cónyuge continúa brindando el servicio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500,  está muy contenta de saber que existen personas que le brindan un apoyo financiero que le permite estar más tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará repuestos como anillos, pistones, monoblock entre otros.
texts.en:
Reyna, 30, has been married to Pascual for 15 years and has three children living with her in her own house.  Reyna provides maintenance, parts replacement and engine cleaning services for river boats.  Her business is installed in a floating barge on the river that can be seen from the city.  Her work yields good income and she feels very tranquil doing this work.  She does it with her husband’s help and thanks to the good quality of their work they’ve established a solid clientele.  She enjoys her work very much and likes to see her customers be very satisfied and that passengers travel safely to their destinations.  She works mornings while afternoons returns home to do her housework while her spouse continues providing the service.

On this occasion she will request 1,500 soles.  She’s very happy to know that people exist who provide financial support that helps her to be more at peace and to make progress with her business plans.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the amount requested to buy spare parts like rings, pistons, engine blocks, etc.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for river boats.

loans.name: Hugo Manuel

texts.es:
Hugo es un hombre de 38 años,es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Hugo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Hugo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos y ganado, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Hugo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar un poco de ganado (ovejas, cabras y cerdos) de esta manera Hugo ampliará su ganado para reproducción, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Hugo is a single 38 year-old man who lives in the city of Chincha with his parents.  He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and he devotes all of his efforts to providing for his family.  Sadly, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Hugo was not able to study for a professional degree.

On his own initiative, Hugo works in his small business raising and selling pigs and other livestock.  He works every day for about 10 hours, and he believes that the business is going well because of his dedication and efforts.

Hugo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing he will be able to buy some more livestock (sheep, goats, and pigs).  In this way, Hugo will expand his stock of animals for breeding so that he can continue to work and exert himself in order to achieve his greatest dream: to finish construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, который живет среди высоких Таджикских гор, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у него проблемы с финансами. Ее зовут  Машхура. Ей 38  лет, не замужем и не имеет детей. Климат ее местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 3 месяцев она занимается скотоводством. Она продает скот, за которым она присматривалась в течение нескольких месяцев. Она хочет развивать свой новый бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  4000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал и развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода она собирается улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A person with a kind heart and a wonderful soul, who lives among the tall Tadzhik mountains, is in need of your financial support.  Her name is Mashhura; she is 38 years old, unmarried and does not have any children.  The climate in the area where she lives is mild and is suitable to growing crops and raising cattle.  Mashhura has been raising cattle for more than three months.  She raises the cattle for a number of months and then she sells it.  She wishes to grow her business but does not have enough finances to do so.  

She is asking for a loan of 4000 somoni to purchase cattle, so she can increase her working capital, and ultimately, to expand her business.  Using the additional income, she is planning to improve her living conditions.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to expand her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is divorced and the mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (three cousins), and earns a living by selling green bananas. She has been in this business for ten years and is requesting a loan for 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income by selling used clothes. She works in a shop six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and increasing prices of green bananas. She hopes to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped-in water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, medication and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Doña Ana se presenta como una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable y luchadora, ella tiene 47 años de edad. Hace tres años le detectaron cáncer en el útero. La han operado dos veces y en este momento tiene los ovarios dañados, pero se encuentra en tratamiento, con buenas condiciones de salud. Su esposo es el que mantiene la casa, ya que es el aporte más grande que hay en el hogar y con la costura Ana aporta una parte a los gastos alimenticios  y vuelve a invertir para confeccionar más artículos que le solicitan. Ana vive con su esposo, tres hijas y dos nietos. Una de las hijas es sorda muda por lo que Ana decidió trabajar desde su casa para atenderla mejor. Cuenta con una mesa y dos máquinas que instaló en el corredor de su casa, su negocio es pequeño pero logra permanecer por el tipo de producto que vende ya que es original y de calidad. Desea este crédito para invertir en compra de materia prima y continuar confeccionando mercadería para apoyar económicamente al hogar.
texts.en:
Ana is a very hardworking, responsible, striving woman. She’s 47-years-old.  She was diagnosed with uterine cancer three years ago.  She’s had two surgeries and at the moment her ovaries are damaged but she’s undergoing treatment and is in good health.  Her husband supports their home since he’s the main breadwinner but Ana sews to pay for part of the food costs and reinvests in order to make more articles of clothing that are requested.

Ana lives with her husband, three daughters and two grandchildren.  One of her daughters is deaf mute which is why Ana decided to work from home in order to better care for her.  

She has a table and two sewing machines installed in her hallway.  Her business is small but it manages to survive because of the type of products she sells which are original and of quality.  She wants this loan to buy raw materials to continue making clothes to support her home economically.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Sara Esther

texts.es:
Sara es una joven de 21 años de edad,  tiene un grado académico de 9° grado, vive con su hija de 9 meses de nacida y su compañero de vida; quien trabaja como motorista hace 6 meses.


Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa ambulante, sale a vender  a los cantones su mercadería, cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, la actividad la aprendió debido a la necesidad que tenía de realizar una actividad productiva. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más ropa de todas las edades, zapatos para vender en los cantones al igual que la ropa. Los zapatos sería algo nuevo que ella ofrecería a su clientela y mayor variedad de ropa. Ella planifica hacer crecer su negocio e instalar  un puesto de venta de ropa y zapatos, para ya no realizarlo ambulante sino fijo.
texts.en:
Sara, 21, is a young woman with ninth grade completed.  She lives with her 9-month-old daughter and with her life companion who has been working as a driver for six months.

She works selling clothes from place to place.  She heads out to various cantons to sell her merchandise.  She has two years’ experience.  She learned this activity because she needed to have a productive activity.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy more clothes for all ages and shoes to sell in the cantons.  The shoes will be something new she will offer her customers as well as a wider variety of clothes.  She plans to make her business grow and to set up a sales stand to sell clothes and shoes to stop doing it from place to place with no fixed locale.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Corixa Beatriz

texts.es:
Corixa joven de 22 años, estudio nada mas el primer año de bachillerato, ella comenta que en ese tiempo que estaba estudiando salió embarazada y no pudo seguir estudiando. Actualmente, vive con su mamá y su esposo que trabaja en una comercial.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar materiales de construcción tales como: bloques, hierro, cemento y la cancelación de la mano de obra del albañil, ya que necesita hacer un muro en su casa, para darle seguridad a su hijo de dos años de edad, que no corra peligro, debido a que el corredor de su casa tiene como un metro de alto del nivel del suelo y su hijo se puede caer y hacer daño

A futuro, quiere que su hijo tenga las mejores condiciones de vida, evitándole accidentes que lo puedan dañar su futuro; ya que ella quiere que su hijo se todo un profesional, sacarlo adelante junto a su esposo para que sea un hombre de bien para la sociedad y que toda su familia se sienta segura.
texts.en:
Corixa is a 22-year-old young woman.  She went to school until her first year of high school.  She says that at that time, when she was in school, she got pregnant and she could no longer continue studying.  She currently lives with her mother and her husband, who works for commercial enterprise. 

The loan that she is now requesting is to pay for construction materials like cement blocks, iron, and cement and to pay for labor from a bricklayer.  She needs to build a wall onto her house to provide security for her two-year-old son so that he is not in danger.  The hallway in her house is about a meter off the ground, and her son could fall and hurt himself.

In the future she wants her son to have the best living conditions.  She wants  him to avoid accidents that could damage his future.  She wants for him to become a total professional.  She and her husband want to get their son ahead so that he can become a good man for society.  She wants the whole family to feel secure.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement blocks, iron, and cement and to pay for labor from a bricklayer.

loans.name: José Roberto

texts.es:
En la fotografía aparece José con su esposa.

José de 40 años de edad, realizo  sus estudios a nivel de bachillerato, con gran esfuerzo, permitiéndole estudiar la carrera técnica en asistencia dental, graduándose como técnico  dental. 

Es casado, su esposa se desempeña en la elaboración de artesanías  en su casa de habitación, junto  con él, han procreado 4 hijos (una niña de 14, 3 niños de 9, ,7 y 1 año);  3 de ellos están realizando estudios de educación básica  y el más pequeño  no estudia  por su edad.

Don José, es propietario de un taller de piezas dentales en la ciudad, con una experiencia de 10 años  en la actividad.  Además,  con su esposa se dedican a  la elaboración de artesanías de barro  las que comercializan en distintas ciudades del país.  Esta labor la aprendió al lado  de su esposa quien desde corta edad lo aprendió de su madre, que también se dedicaba a la elaboración de artesanías de barro, en los meses de octubre a diciembre  se  trasladan a otra ciudad a venderlas.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar pintura, material de barro ya moldeado y el pago  de artesanas que le apoyan, desde hace un tiempo, en la finalización del producto para ponerlo  a la venta y generar mejores ingresos  al ofertar  más productos.  

En el futuro, desea incrementar la producción de artesanías,  ya que le genera ingresos adicionales  que permite que sus hijos,  concluyan sus estudios de bachillerato y que continúen en la universidad.
texts.en:
José appears in the photo with his wife.  He’s 40-years-old and completed high-school with much effort leading to a technical career as a dental assistant; he graduated as a dental assistant.

He’s married and his wife works making crafts at home with him.  They’ve had four children (a 14-year-old girl and boys that are 9, 7 and 1).  Three of them are taking basic education and the youngest does not attend school because of his age.

José owns a dental workshop in the city and has ten years’ experience in this activity.  In addition, he and his wife make clay crafts that they sell in various cities in the country.  He learned this work alongside his wife who learned it at a very young age from her mother who also worked making clay crafts.  From October to December they move to a different city to sell them.

The loan he’s requesting is to buy paint and already produced clay figures and to pay artisans that have helped him for some time now to finish the products to put them up for sale and to generate higher income by having more products to sell.

In future, he wants to increase crafts production because it generates extra income that makes it possible for his children to complete high-school and continue on to university.

loans.use: to buy paint and clay figures.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Julio no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica.
Por iniciativa propia, Julio trabaja como operario de maquinas de planchado en una empresas de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Julio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos médicos de su madre, ya que dese pagar las consultas y comprar medicinas, de esta manera espera calmar las dolencias de su madre,así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Julio is a 32 year-old man who lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and small child.  He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and he devotes all of his efforts to providing for his family.  Regrettably, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Julio was not able to study for a degree in mechanical engineering.

On his own initiative, Julio works operating ironing machines for a company in his city.  He works every day for about 8 hours, and he believes that his job is going well because of his dedication and efforts.

Julio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help that they are providing, he will be able to pay for some medical expenses for his mother.  He wants to pay for medical consultations and medicines in order to relieve the ailments of his mother.  He plans to continue to work and exert himself so that he can achieve his greatest dream: to have his own house.

loans.use: to pay for his mother's medical expenses

loans.name: T'mixe Group

texts.es: El Grupo T'Mixe es grupo que se encuentra en una comunidad mazahua es una localidad muy tranquila tiene muchas fiestas patronales para las personas de la comunidad es muy bueno tener todas estas fiestas son muy celebradas cada una de ellas. El nombre del grupo está en Mazahua significa pozo y los integrantes decidieron ponerle así porque donde se reunen para hacer sus cobranzas hay un pozo del cual pueden extraer agua limpia y purificada al parecer el agua de ese pozo es muy saludable los habitantes de la comunidad prefieren este tipo de agua. Doña Juanita quien  es la representante del grupo tiene 45 años de edad está casada con el señor Sebastián desde hace 26 años juntos han formado una familia con tres cinco hijos de los cuales ya solo dos dependen de dicha pareja. Doña Juanita está solicitando un crédito a Vision Fund y KIVA para comprar refacciones para el taxi de su esposo Sebastián, Doña Juanita se dedica a la venta de productos de Herbalife “Inicie mi negocio porque yo estaba enferma, me ofrecieron estos productos al parecer me funcionaron por eso decidí iniciar con la venta de estos productos aquí en la comunidad hay muchas personas  enfermas y quizás pueda ayudar para sanarlas” Por el momento solo comparte sus productos con sus vecinas, amigas y familiares Doña Juanita siempre ha dicho “Para recomendarlo a otras personas necesito primero yo probar el producto”. En el negocio de Doña Juanita todo marcha muy bien tiene muy poquito pero se ha ido haciendo de clientes y sus ganancias han podido ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar. En el negocio de su esposo algunos días no le va muy bien pero como en todo negocio hay altas pero otros días son bajos en cuanto a las ganancias. El sueño de Doña Juanita es poder llegar a tener un local bien establecido  con todas las instalaciones adecuadas donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Los integrantes del grupo son Leticia quien invertirá su crédito para compra pollos de granjas, Maxima, Albina, Francisca, Amelia y Alberta invertirán en sus borregos finalmente Ángeles invertirá en su molino de nixtamal ellas están muy agradecidas con la institución porque llevan ya varios años con sus actividades y todo gracias a los créditos otorgados.
texts.en:
The “T’Mixe” group is located in a Mazahua community, a very tranquil location with many feast days for the people from the community.  Having all these feast days is very good and each one of them is celebrated fully.

The name of the group is in Mazahua and it means “Well.”  The members of the group decided on this name because where they meet to make their payments there is a well from which clean, pure water can be extracted.  That well’s water is very healthful and the residents of this community prefer that type of water.

Juanita, 45, is the group representative.  She’s been married to Sebastián for 26 years and they’ve formed a family consisting of five children only two of which are still dependent on the couple.

Juanita’s asking VisionFund and Kiva for a loan to buy spare parts for her husband Sebastián’s taxi.  Juanita works selling Herbalife products.  “I started my business because I was ill and they offered me these products and apparently they worked which is why I decided to start to sell them here in the community where there are many ill people; perhaps I can help cure them.”

For the moment, she only shares her products with her neighbors, friends and family.  Juanita has always said: “In order to recommend them to others, I must first try the product myself.”

Everything in Juanita’s business is running quite well.  She only has a little but she’s been acquiring customers and her profits have helped her cover her household expenses.

Her husband doesn’t do to well some days in his business because like in all businesses there are up days and down days with respect to profits.  

Juanita’s dream is to someday have a well-established locale with all required furnishings so she can better tend to her customers.

The group members are Leticia who will use her loan to buy farm chickens, Máxima, Albina, Francisca, Amelia and Alberta who will invest in their sheep and finally Ángeles who will invest in her corn mill.  They are all very grateful to the institution because they’ve been in business several years now all thanks to the granted loans.

loans.use: to buy taxi spare parts.

location.town: San Nicolas Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Jean Roger

texts.es:
Jean es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jean no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía.
Por iniciativa propia, Jean trabaja como recepcionista en una empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Jean se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una cama,a ya que actualmente el y su pequeño hermano comparten una sola cama, de esta manera desea brindar un poco de bienestar para su familia, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Jean is a single youth of 19 years.  He lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica, in the Parcona district.  He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and he has a strong desire to excel. Regrettably, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Jean has not been able to study for a degree in culinary arts.

On his own initiative, Jean works as a receptionist in a company in the city.  He works every day for about 10 hours, and he believes that his job is going well because of his dedication and efforts.

Jean is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help that they are providing, he will buy a bed, because he and his younger brother currently share a single bed.  In this way, he wants to provide his family with greater well-being.  Jean plans to continue to work and exert himself so that he can achieve his greatest dream: to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy a bed

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es: María Del Rosario es socia de la “Unión Regional” desde hace ya varios años y allí entrega toda su producción de café para que sea procesada y exportada. Hace un mes María Del Rosario resembró parte de su finca pues tiene planeado aumentar su producción para dentro de 2 años que comiencen a dar frutos. Para que todo salga de acuerdo a lo que tiene planeado es necesario fertilizar su terreno y para eso solicita un crédito, el cual pagará al final de la cosecha. Además de dedicarse al café María Del Rosario cuenta con una tienda de dulces en su casa de la cual obtiene dinero extra para contribuir a la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Maria Del Rosario has been a member of the "Unión Regional" for several years.  That is where she delivers all of her coffee production to be processed and exported.  One month ago Maria Del Rosario replanted part of her farm.  She plans to increase  her production so that within two years it will start to bear fruit.

For everything to go according to her plan, she needs to fertilize her land.  That is why she is requesting a loan, which she will repay at the end of the harvest.  In addition to growing coffee, Maria Del Rosario has a candy store at her house.  She gets extra money from the store, which contributes to the family's finances.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Alfredo Junior

texts.es:
Alfredo es un hombre de 24 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia;lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Alfredo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Alfredo trabaja como estibador para diversos comerciantes en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Alfredo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada terminar a de construir una vivienda, de esta manera brindara mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un puesto de verduras.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a 24 year old man. He lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and their two young children. He is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and dedicates all his efforts to raising his family. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources and because of the need to work, Alfred could not study for a professional career.

On his own initiative Alfred works as a dockworker for various merchants in his city. He works every day for about 10 hours and he thinks that he is doing well because of his dedication and effort.

Alfred is very grateful to Kiva lenders as thanks to the help he can finish building a home, and in this way he can provide greater security and wellbeing for his family, and also continue working and struggling to achieve his big dream of having a vegetable stand.

loans.use: to buy supplies so he can finish the construction of his house

loans.name: Dobora Kukua

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Dobora Kukua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling porridge in Mpeasem (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. 

Dobora Kukua is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Dobora Kukua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which would allow her to prepare more porridge and sell greater quantitites. In the long term, Dobora Kukua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to prepare more porridge and sell greater quantities.

loans.name: Brenda Maria

texts.es: Doña Brenda continua con sus planes a futuro, por los cuales a luchado ya que su mayor sueño es poder terminar su casa y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, con el credito anterior realizo el aranque de un cuarto que dejo hasta la mitad y luego utilio Madera. con este refinanciamiento completara todo el cuarto por lo que necesita comprar Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Hierro. para continuar la construccion del cuarto, Agradece el apoyo que se le esta brindado.
texts.en: Brenda is continuing with her plans for the future, for which she has struggled, because her major dream is to be able to finish her home and improve her living conditions. With the previous loan she started the renovation of a room which was abandoned half-way, and then used wood. With this refinancing she aims to complete the room. In order to continue she needs to buy blocks, cement, sand and iron. She is very grateful for the help that she is given.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Job

texts.es:
